Ten years ago she began a small food business.  Over the years, thanks to the good location of her home, which is in a tourist location that is visited by many foreign and local tourists, she has managed to adapt the location into a restaurant, where she sells traditional food dishes.  "What sells the most are the chicken broth at breakfast time as well as the cracklings of pork and guinea pig (native jungle animals)", she says.  Her prices vary from 10 to 30 soles.  But she adds that the people mainly eat foods that cost 12 to 20 soles.
The sales are not always good.  In the months of January and February they lessen, but they go up starting in March, especially in July and December.
Milka is happy with her work, because she likes what she does.  Her dedication to the preparation of the food is the secret for getting the acceptance of her customers.  Now she hopes to remodel her business in order to make it more bright and eye-catching.  This will be her first loan that she obtains from MFP.  She feels very excited about joining the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen", where all the women are responsible.  For that reason she mentions that she will be punctual with the payment of her monthly dues.
With the money from the loan, she will buy new plates, more utensils like spoons, forks, and pots, as well as ingredients for the preparation of her typical dishes.

loans.use: buy spoons, forks, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru: Тахмина замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она очень целеустремленная и добросовестная женщина. Более 3 лет  она занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Она является владельцем бизнеса, а муж ей помогает в торговле и поставки товаров. Продает молочные продукты, колбасные изделия и напитки. Тахмина хотела бы получить займ в размере 8000 Сомони для приобретения товаров с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Takhmina is married and is a loving mother of three children. She is a very goal-oriented and conscientious woman. For more than three years she been in business selling groceries. Takhmina is the owner and her husband helps her with sales and procurement. She sells dairy products, sausage and drinks. Takhmina has requested a loan of 8000 Tajik somoni (TJS) to purchase additional inventory to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Tedy Tatiana

texts.es: Tedy  vive con sus hijos 3 hijos en las edades de 7 a 11 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en profesionales exitosos. Desde hace tres años se separó de su cónyuge y debió   buscar ingresos para  lograr responder a la satisfacción de   necesidades primarias en su familia, por eso inició su negocio con los cuales ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Ella tiene una pequeña variedades donde vende útiles escolares y también tiene clientes a quienes distribuye mercancía para el hogar como electrodomésticos menores y artículos femeninos. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente a crédito, mientras  sus compras de contado. Como  gradualmente su clientela crece y no alcanza a responderles oportunamente,   está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar cartlinas, cuadernos, lapices, boligrafos, aprovechando la época de ingreso de los estudiantes al colegio, donde se incrementan las ventas de útiles y papelería en general, lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa, porque además de su experiencia la aplica en temporada en la que usualmente ocurre el mayor incremento de sus ventas. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo, por eso se esmera diariamente trabajando,  para lograr aumentarlo y con el apoyo de sus credikiva.
texts.en:
Tedy lives with her three children who are between the ages of 7 and 11. She dreams of seeing them become successful professionals. Three years ago she separated from her spouse and had to look for a source of income, in order to meet the basic needs of her family. This is why she started her business, which has managed to cover the household expenses. 

She has a small varieties shop where she sells school supplies. She also has clients to whom she distributes home products, like small electrical appliances and women's accessories. Her sales are primarily on a credit basis, while she pays for her merchandise in cash. 

As her client base is gradually growing and Tedy can't respond to clients promptly, she is asking for a loan via Kiva - her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She is taking advantage of the time when students are admitted to school and will buy construction paper, notebooks, pencils, and pens. This is when sales of school supplies and paper products increase in general, so her investment will be successful. Furthermore, in her experience this is the time when the greatest increase in her sales usually occurs. 

Tedy's greatest challenge is working capital, and for this reason she does her very best working every day, so that it will grow along with the help of a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy construction paper, notebooks, pencils and pens.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 36 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Prudencio de 35 años y sus 06 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una buena calidad de vida. Juana, es una mujer muy empeñosa y se dedica con mucho esmero al cultivo de café junto a su esposo; ambos saben que tienen que competir por tener la mejor producción puesto que sus vecinos de su localidad también producen café. Juana lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y comenta que para ella es muy difícil tener que combatir con las plagas que abaten sus plantaciones. Es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para que le ayuden con los planes de trabajo que se propone a realizar para cuidar sus siembras. Juana, espera el apoyo de los financistas para que pueda lograr con sus planes de trabajo y con el tiempo llegar a obtener la mejor cosecha de toda su localidad, por tanto solicita su crédito numero 13 para continuar avanzando con su actividad. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará insecticidas para combatir con las plagas que afectan sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Prudencio, age 35. They have six beloved children for whom they want to provide a good quality of life. Juana is a very industrious woman who grows coffee with great care along with her husband. Both of them know how to compete since they have the best production as compared to their neighbors in the area who also grow coffee. Juana has been in this line of work for 28 years and says that her greatest difficulty is combating pests that hinder the crops she has planted. For this reason, she came to the offices of MFP for assistance with her work plans that will help to maintain her crops. Juana hopes that the help of the Kiva lenders will enable her to fulfill her plans. Over time, she hopes to achieve the best harvest in her town.

Juana is requesting her 13th loan so that she can advance her business. With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy insecticides to combat pests that are impacting her cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy insecticides.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  es conviviente,  tiene 33  años de edad y tiene 2 hijos, actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “Las Tres Marias” grupo  conformado por  6  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Maria   se dedica a la venta de comida es decir vende ceviche y mariscos en una carreta  los fines de semana y a su vez trabaja en casa , Maria empezó este negocio con la idea de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijos van a la escuela  , se ha comprado un terreno, Maria  a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar una casa prefabricada e instalarlo en el terreno que ella tiene para vivir con su familia. Maria  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria, age 33, is in a common-law marriage and has two children. She is currently a member of the Communal Bank “Las Tres Marias” (The Three Marys), a group that consists of six individuals who engage in different business activities. Maria sells food such as “ceviche” (marinated seafood) and shellfish from a cart on the weekends. Other times she works at home. Maria started this business because she wanted to provide a better quality of life for her family. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has been able to earn more income so that her children can go to school. She was also able to buy a piece of land.

Maria is requesting a new loan so that she can buy a prefabricated house to be placed on her land in order to have a place to live with her family. She will reach her goals through hard work and effort and the loans from EDAPROSPO will be of help.

loans.use: to purchase a prefabricated house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 36 años y convive con Ever, el padre de sus 4 hijos de 20, 16, 12 y 4 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en la localidad Kimiri en el distrito y provincia de Chanchamayo. Norma es una mujer de negocios. Su carácter emprendedor la hace enfrentarse a cualquier oportunidad donde pueda desenvolverse como comercializadora. Empezó vendiendo refrescos y bebidas heladas en su propio hogar. Ahora ya cuenta con un establecimiento donde expende comestibles, golosinas, abarrotes, productos de primera necesidad, e incluso comida. “Cocino para pensionistas, preparo desayuno y almuerzo para trabajadores de una empresa de luz”, menciona.
Le va bien en esta actividad, pero ella quiere llegar más lejos. Redecorar su local para atender a más clientes, ya que sus comidas tienen buena aceptación, además del trato cordial y alegre que la distingue.
Es así, que ampliará su local con 2 mesas y sillas para recibir con comodidad a sus compradores.
Por su parte Ever trabaja en una panadería aportando ingresos mensuales a la canasta familiar. De esa manera Norma y su familia viven en concordia. Sería la primera vez que Norma accedería a un crédito de MFP, por ende se responsabiliza de pagar con exactitud las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al recientemente formado, banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen”. Se siente cómoda por estar acompañada de mujeres trabajadoras. Con el dinero ella podrá compra 2 sacos de arroz, 1 de azúcar, víveres para surtir los productos de su tienda y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old and lives with her partner Ever, the father of their four children, ages 20, 16, 12, and 4. She and her family live in their own house in the town of Kimiri in the district and province of Chanchamayo. Norma is a businesswoman. Her entrepreneurial character makes her take up any opportunity where she can do well as a merchant. She began selling soft drinks and frozen beverages in her own home. Now she has an establishment where she sells foodstuffs, candies, groceries, basic necessities, and even food. "I cook for retired people, I prepare breakfast and lunch for workers at a light company," she mentions.

This business is going well for her, but she wants to go further, to redecorate her premises to serve more customers, since her dishes are very popular, in addition to the cordial and happy service which distinguishes her. 

It is thus that she will expand her premises with two tables and chairs in order to receive her customers with comfort.

On his part, Ever works in a bakery, supporting the family needs with monthly income. In this way, Norma and her family live in harmony. This will be the first time that Norma will have access to a loan from MFP. Therefore, she will take responsibility for making her monthly payments precisely. She belongs to the recently formed communal bank Virgen de Carmen. She feel comfortable to be united with hard-working women. With the money she will buy two sacks of rice, one of sugar, foodstuffs to stock the products of her store, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice, 1 of sugar, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, trabaja como chofer asalariado en un sindicato de trufis en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un muro de contención en su vivienda para dar más seguridad a su familia.
Ramiro es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales viven en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ramiro works as a salaried driver for a taxi union in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a retaining wall for his home so that his family will have greater safety. Ramiro is married and has two children who live in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall for his home.

loans.name: Nora Julia

texts.es:
Nora sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

Nora sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo. 

Nora continúa trabajando con la venta de productos energéticos y alimenticios traídos desde el país de Suiza.  Nora con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad Nora requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos energéticos.
texts.en:
Nora continues to belong to the communal bank "Inti" of the Arariwa Association in the department of Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is in its third year of functioning, and it is going very well for all the members. ("Inti" is a word from the Quechua language that translates into Spanish as "sol" (sun).)

Nora continues to live in the historic city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, the majority of the people work in different types of businesses and offer services, since the businesses are strongly associated with tourism.

Nora continues working in the sale of energy products and foods brought from the country of Switzerland. She did very well with the last loan and was able to increase her income. At this time, Nora needs the loan to buy more energy products.

loans.use: to buy more energy products

loans.name: Raima

texts.es:
Raima, de 39 años es una mujer luchadora. Sola, sacó a delante a sus 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos Ingrid y Yadira a las que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijas, convertirlas en profesionales y que lleven una vida sana y en valores. Por eso trabaja sin descanso, ya que sabe de lo importante que es ahorrar. Su principal ingreso económico es la venta de comida casera en un restaurante que puso en su casa, ahí vende todos los días sin descanso, los fines de semana, prepara comida típica como “cuy y chicharrón colorado”, que lo consume muchas personas, ya que es un plato exquisito. Pero a diferencia de los otros restaurantes, ella tiene un bar exclusivo con mesas silla y música donde vende cerveza, cuenta que el fin de semana obtiene muchas ganancias, en ese producto. También cuando hace mucho, sus clientes comprar gaseosa helada en gran cantidad. Sus planes en la actualidad es convertirse en comerciante mayorista de cerveza, y ser una distribuidora reconocida. Tiene la convicción de lograr su objetivo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mujeres solidarias” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Raima de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cerveza y gaseosa para surtir su restaurante
texts.en:
Raima Is 39, and a determined woman. She raised five children on her own, of whom only two, Ingrid and Yadira, are living with her. She looks after them in her own house, located in the town of Tambo. Her greatest dream is to help her daughters get ahead in life; to see them become professionals, and live a healthy and principled life. That's why she works tirelessly, as she knows how important it is to save. 

Her main source of income is selling homemade food in a restaurant she has set up in her house. There she sells every day, without a break. On weekends she prepares traditional food, such as "cuy y chicharrón colorado" (a spicy traditional dish made from guinea pig and pork), which many people eat, as it is an exquisite dish.  

But unlike other restaurants, she has an exclusive bar with tables, chairs, and music, where she sells beer. She says that on the weekend she makes a lot of profits from that product. She also does well when her customers buy iced soft drinks in great quantity. Currently her plan is to become a beer wholesaler, and be a well-known distributor. She has the conviction to reach her objective. 

She belongs to the 'Mujeres Solidarias" solidarity group, and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is happy to know that she will receive a loan to move forward with her business.  Moreover, she promises to once more make her installment payments. When she receives the loan, Raima will use the money applied for to buy beer and soft drinks for supplying her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Avanzando Hacia Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Nicolaza, de 54 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la IV zona de Collique en el distrito de Comas. Ella es integrante del grupo "Avanzando hacia un futuro", formado por 8 personas quienes la eligieron como la Presidenta de la Junta Directiva de su grupo.
Desde hace seis meses tiene su negocio de venta de calzado que lo inició a inicitiva propia con un pequeño ahorro que tenía y que lo invirtió como capital de trabajo, le ha ido bien, y tiene como uno de sus planes a futuro poder confeccionar su propio calzado y tener su marca.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de calzado escolar y aumentar su stock para atender y aumentar a su clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Nicolaza, who is 54 years old, has two children and lives in the IV zone of Colique in the district of Comas. She is a member of the group "Avanzando hacia un Futuro" (advancing toward a future), formed by eight people who elected her president of the board of directors of her group.

Since six months ago, she has had a business selling footwear, which she began on her own initiative with a little savings that she had and that she invested as working capital. It has gone very well for her, and she has as one of her plans for the future to be able to make her own footwear and have her own brand.

She will invest the loan that she receives in the purchase of school shoes and to increase her stock to serve and increase her clientele.

loans.use: to invest in her footwear business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Kator. She is a food stall seller and has been in business for five years. She is 40 year old, married, and has six children between the ages of 20 and 10. All of them are still in school. 

Loice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase maize and cassava flour. Loice hopes that in the future she will be able to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: La Nueva Alcancía  Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” está conformada por 07 mujeres  entusiastas de comenzar  a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad, siendo Mirhta  la  secretaria del grupo. Mirhta tiene 29 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo aún dependiente. Mirhta lleva más de 02 años dedicándose a la artesanía en platería, este negocio surgió gracias a un familiar que la indujo a emprender su propio negocio, el dinero que percibe es de mucha ayuda pues puede seguir apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios, y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida . El deseo de Mirhta es de instalar en su domicilio un  taller artesanal donde pueda realizar sus trabajos. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda (pintado). La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en: The new communal bank "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (triumphant women) consists of 7 women who are enthusiastic about beginning to work with the Prosperity Program. Mirhta is the secretary of the group. She is 29 years old and is separated, with one son who is still a dependent. Mirhta has worked as a craftsperson in silver for more than two years. This business arose thanks to a relative who persuaded her to pursue her own business. The money that she receives is a great help since she can continue supporting her son with his education and in this way improve his quality of life. Mirhta's wish is to install in her home a handicraft studio where she can do her work. At this time she is applying for the loan to improve her house (painted). The communal bank "Mujeres Triunfadoras" is grateful for the loans offered since they make their progress possible.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Lenah Nyambura

texts.en:
Lenah still runs a beauty shop and now has a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Lenah will use the loan to buy cosmetics for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her shop

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 41 years old, married, with 4 children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Julia Mariana

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 43 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropas.

Su historia comenzó porque necesitaba incrementar sus ingresos con pocas cosas o ropa vendió a familiares pero ahora vende a amigos y vecinos, trabaja sola todos los días sale a vender desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche, tiene dificultades las distancias entre su casa y la parte céntrica de la parroquia, si está casada el esposo trabaja como bodeguero en la coca cola, tiene 3 hijos pequeños están en escuela fiscal. 

Su sueño es darle estabilidad  económica a su familia y terminar nuestra de construir su casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para tener mas ingresos en sus ventas de ropa comprando ropa como pantalones, blusas.
texts.en:
Julia is a 43-year-old woman who has many goals for her clothing-sales business to prosper in the coming years.

Her story began because she needed to increase her income.  She sold a few things or clothing to family members, but now she sells to friends and neighbors.  She works alone.  Every day she goes out to sell from 3 in the afternoon until 7 in the evening.  What is difficult for her are the distances between her house and the central areas of the parish.

She is married and her husband works as a warehouseman for Coca-Cola.  She has three young children who are in public school.

Her dream is to give her family financial stability and finish building her house.  For this reason she wants the loan, to have more income in her clothing sales by buying clothes such as pants and blouses.

loans.use: to buy pants and blouses.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Amadou ; il est célibataire sans  enfant .Il est menuisier depuis 5 ans, métier qu’il a embrassé sous l’influence d’un de ces amis qui exerce aussi ce métier.
Avec le crédit, Amadou voudrait acheter de la matière première : du  bois, de la colle et fabriquer des lits, des armoires, des coiffeuses pour les exposer au fin de les revendre.
Bien qu’étant célibataire, il gère la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Dans l’avenir  il aimerait acheter une machine  pour augmenter son volume de production et minimiser ses charges de fonctionnement.
texts.en: This borrower's name is Amadou.  He is single, with no children.  He has been working as a carpenter for 5 years.  He embraced this professional activity encouraged by one of his friends who also works in this field.  With his loan, Amadou would like to buy some raw materials, such as wood and glue,  and build beds, wardrobes and dressers, which he will display and sell.  Although he is single, Amadou manages his family daily expenses.  In the future, he would like to buy a machine that would allow him to increase his volume of production and minimize his operating costs.

loans.use: to buy wood, in order to build and sell furniture.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 39-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Virginia, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya a ouvert il y'a 4 mois un restaurant avec un fast food et une "dibiterie".Elle emploie trois personnes comme serveuses et cuisinières. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont les 5 sont des élèves.Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter du riz, des oignons, de l'huile et d'autres denrées alimentaires. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'import - export.
texts.en: Rohkaya opened a restaurant four months ago, with a fast-food service and "dibiterie" (food stall where grilled meat is served).  She employs three people as waitresses and cooks.  She is married and the mother of 6 children, 5 of whom attend school.  She manages to make some profits which allow her to meet her family's needs.  In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 francs which will help her to buy some rice, onions, oil and other food products.  Her goal is to launch an import/export business.

loans.use: to buy rice, onions, oil, and other food products.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik was born in 1960. He lives in Sevan with his wife. His three children, two sons and a daughter, live separately from their parents.  

Rafik is a locksmith and worked as a worker for many years. But since 1992, Rafik and his wife have been engaged in the fruits and vegetables trade. Every three days Rafik goes to Yerevan, where he buys merchandise for his business. While Rafik is purchasing, his wife stays at the stall instead of her husband. Thanks to their occupation, Rafik and his wife provide for their family.
 
This is Rafik’s second loan from Nor Horizon, and now he needs a 500.000 Armenian dram (AMD) loan to buy large lots of apples, pears, citruses and different vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to buy large lots of apples, pears, citruses and different vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 36 years old. She has one child who is four years old. She has been sells bananas and vegetables for the past three years. Mediatrice requested the loan to buy more bananas and vegetables to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business. In the future, she would like to have different places to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Velena

texts.en: Velena is 45 years old. She has four children between 5 and 18 years old. All of them attend school except the youngest. She is a very active lady who is dedicated to expanding her business and she is very thankful for the benefits from the business, which help her family. Velena needs the new loan to add more items like flour to her business. With the profits, she will pay school fees and water extension at her home.

loans.use: To buy more flour to sell.

loans.name: Clemenine

texts.en: Clemenine has two children and both of them go to school. Her husband works as a tax conductor. Clemenine sells different items in her shop, which she has been running for the past year. She says that she needs a loan to buy more items to sell. With the profits, she will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Working Together Group

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Prudence from Mutare, Zimbabwe. She is single with one child who attends school.  Prudence runs a retail business selling footwear and electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge faced is creditors failing to pay on time. Prudence has requested a loan of $400 to buy more stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the payment pattern for paying school fees for her child. In the future, Prudence plans to be able to go to China to buy footwear and other electrical goods for resale.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 25 years old and single. She owns a bar, which she has been running for the past three years. Julienne will use the loan to buy more beer to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Dimbalante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Dimbelanté est crée le 21 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes habitant le même village et exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce.

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Sokhna est responsable du groupe. Elle est agée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Avec son prêt, elle va acheter de la marchandise pour son commerce de denrées diverses (riz, huile, arachides etc. Elle a capitalisé une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années

Les recettes générées par son commerce lui serviront à participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants et aider son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en: The Dimbalanté solidarity group was created on December 21, 2009.  It consists of 15 women who all live in the same village and are involved in small retail business.  Sokhna is the facilitator of the group.  She is standing to the right in the photo, with her hand raised.  She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children.  With her loan, she will buy some food products (such as rice, oil, groundnut etc.) for her retail food business.  Over the years, she has acquired a good experience in this field of activity.  Thanks to the profits generated by her business, she will contribute to her children's education fees and help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, groundnut etc.

loans.name: Euprasie

texts.en: Euprasie has three children aged between 1 and 8 years. She works together with her husband in the boutique business, which she has been running for the last 4 years. Euprasie wants to add different items such as lotions, maize flour, sugar and retail items to sell. She plans to use the profits towards building a house, which she will be using as a her residence.

loans.use: To buy more items like maize flour, sugar and lotions to sell.

loans.name: The Agro Produce Marketier Group

texts.en:
This is 47 year old Edson from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. He is married and has four children, two attend school.  

Edson runs an agriculture business selling farm produce. The business has been in operation for 10 years. He says the main challenges he faces are that some products go bad before being sold, and other products are seasonal. Edson has requested a loan of $300 to buy some farm produce for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to build another family house. In the future, Edson plans to open more markets and to be an employer.

loans.use: to buy more farm produce for resale.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 45 years old, a mixed crop farmer, he is married to Joyce, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

Festus is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD., after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Festus will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help him to improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Pepukai Group

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Joseph from Mutare, Zimbabwe. He is married with four children, three attending school. He also cares for two dependents. Joseph runs a tailoring business, making trousers, school uniforms and baby wear. The business has been in operation for 10 years. He says the main challenges faced are material shortages and electricity being in short supply. Joseph has requested a loan of $300 to buy materials for tailoring. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the family's welfare. In the future, Joseph plans to open more markets and to be an employer.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Sussana

texts.en: Sussana lives in the Airport Community. She is 26 years old and single with three children between 1 month and 13 years old. Two of the children are in school and all of them live at home. For the past three years now, she has been selling eggs and groundnuts in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more eggs and groundnuts for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs and groundnuts

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 62 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is a widow with two children. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the 10 years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Pauline will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is 29 years old. She is a mother of one child. She sells skirts and blouses to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for  20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy blouses and skirts to resell.

loans.use: to buy blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
James is a 22 years old business man. He is married to Josephine, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 26,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy a motorbike. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like, sugar, royco, tea leaves, milk and many others.

loans.name: Sunshine Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42 year old Never from Mutare. He is married. He has four children, one attending school. Never runs a manufacturing business of making Peanut Butter. The business has been in operation for 15 years. He says the main challenges faced are transport costs are too high to ferry groundnuts from the surrounding farmers. Never has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy groundnuts for making peanut butter. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the welfare of his family. In the future Never plans to supply peanut butter to the wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts for making peanut butter.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 47 years old. She lives in Samtredia District. Nana isn’t married and lives with the family of her brother Alexander, his wife and nephew. 

Nana works as an accountant in a local private company. Her brother serves in the country’s army. Nana’s sister-in-law is a housewife. Along with her main job, Nana is actively involved in the family agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with four cows. Nana and her sister-in-law produce cheese and sell on average 60 kilos of this product on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Though the family members work hard, their income still isn’t enough to save for the renovation of their house, which is old and needs repair. Nana requested credit for its renovation. After using the credit according to the predetermined purpose, the family will be able to improve their living conditions and spend their evenings after hard work days in a better, cleaner environment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old and blessed with four children who are 22, 15, 10, and 9 years old, respectively. She sells clothes, a business she ventured into 15 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 that she will use to purchase bales of clothes to sell. The profit she earns will help her repay her loan. 

Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en: This is 34 year old Mutizwa from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. He is married and has five children, four attending school. Mutizwa runs a retail business of selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. He says the main challenges faced are high customs duty on clothes. Mutizwa has requested a loan of $150 to buy more clothes for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the family's welfare. In the future, Mutizwa plans to open a clothing shop in the central business district.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 33 year old business man. He is married to Elizabeth, a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a cosmetics shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Daniel will use the loan to purchase stock of cosmetics for his shop.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to start a salon for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics for his shop.

loans.name: Love

texts.en:
Love lives in Air Port Community and is 25 years old. Single, Love lives with two children, aged 4 and 10, both are in school and live at home. 

For the past two years, Love has been selling bread and biscuits in her community. She enjoys the profit making and has more customers, since she is the only one who sells bread and quality biscuits in her community. Love is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and biscuits for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
For the last three years John has been selling milk in Kiambu town. He is a 30 year old single man.

John was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend who is also a KADET client. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan amount to purchase more milk for resale.

In the future, John hopes to expand his business and open several milk bars in Kiambu town.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is a 37-year-old gentleman from Vihiga town, situated in the Western part of Kenya and is married to Eunice who operates a tailoring business.

Hudson operates a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last two years, making a monthly income of KES 11,000. He is taking his ninth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat worth KES 40,000. He will use his profits to provide basic needs for his family.

His dream is to continue investing in his business through KADET LTD.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, e.g  sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 28 years old. He lives in a small village in West Georgia with his family: wife – Teona, two children (7 and 4 years old) and parents (retired). Gia is leading the agricultural business for the family. His parents help him. The family owns 2 milk cows. They produce traditional West Georgian cheese and sell it at the local market. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns a 1 hectare plot of the land, where melons and water-melons, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers and eggplants are grown. Gia sells harvested products on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris, including the pensions of Gia’s parents. 

Gia has requested credit for cultivation of the plot and to purchase quality seeds of melons and watermelons. After proper cultivation and sowing high quality seeds, Gia can count on a high quality harvest in summer, which will be sold for a good price on the local open market. The family will get a good income. Gia plans to make some savings which will be used for renovation of a part of the house which is old-renovated and needs make-up.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and seeds for melon and watermelon.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 54 года. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Бахтиёр открыл магазин, где продает парфюмерию и продукты питания. В этой области он 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых продуктов.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 54 years old, married and has one child. Bakhtiyor opened a store where he sells perfumes and food products. He has been in this business for twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy necessary products.

loans.use: to purchase necessary products.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en: Marie Vianney is the father of two children. All his children go to school. He needs a loan to buy more products to sell in the boutique, which he has been running for a period of 10 years. He plans to use the profits to increase the capacity of his business as well as to invest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in the boutique.

loans.name: Wuvu

texts.en:
Wuvu lives in Air Port Community. She is 40 years old, married and her husband is a builder (Construction). They have three children between 7 and 20 years old, all of them are in school and live at home

For the past twenty years, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plans is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old, a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Elijah, a business man. They are blessed with three children. Mary has been a mixed crop farmer for the past ten years. Her monthly income of KES 9,000 supports her family.

Mary is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture in to pig rearing, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Medea

texts.en:
Medea is 36 years old. She is married and lives in the village of Tobanieri, West Georgia with her family: husband Jumber and three children (13, 12 and 1 years old). The family lives in poverty and they receive relevant social assistance from the local government. Medea is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have three milk cows. Medea produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of this product to local dairy product retailers. Also the family owns 0.8 hectares of land where they grow maize, nuts, peppers and eggplants. Jumber sells the harvested products to local greengrocery retailers.

Jumber works as a truck driver. He rents a truck and provides freight transportation service to local companies and individuals. The total average monthly income of the family, including social assistance, is 700 Laris. 

Medea requested a loan for purchasing a used truck. They have made some savings, which will be added to the borrowed amount and Jumber will purchase a truck. He won’t have to rent it any more, and his income from the transportation service will double. The family members will use the increased income to purchase household goods as well as necessary goods for the children, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a used truck

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 32 years old with 2 children who are school aged. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises pigeons. This business started some years ago and she gets a good profit from her business. Participating in our credit program in 2010, she used loans to buy pairs of pigeons for raising. For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy food for pigeons and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy food for pigeons and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en: Ebrahim is 52 years old, married, and has four children. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 7 years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Moustapha Lô Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Moustapha Lô est créé le 27 décembre 2010, il est constitué de treize femmes qui sont issues du même quartier.

Madame Aminata est âgée de 59 ans, mariée elle est mère de sept enfants. Elle vend des tissus et autres produits divers, elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 20 ans et a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou rose avec un châle autour des épaules.

Elle achète ses produits ( tissus wax  voile, beurre de karité, encens, savon etc.) dans deux grandes villes du pays et revend au marché central de la ville.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises de qualité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle participe aux dépenses familiales et aide ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Moustapha Lô solidarity group was founded on December 27, 2010. The group is comprised of 13 women who all live in the same area.

Madame Aminata is 59 years old, married, and is a mother to seven children. She’s been selling fabric and other miscellaneous items for more than 20 years with good experience.

In the photo, she is standing at right wearing a pink boubou with a shawl around her shoulders.

She buys her products (fabric, “wax,” “voile,” shea butter, incense, soap, etc.) in two of the country’s big cities and she resells them in the city’s central market.

With her loan, she’d like to buy high-quality goods to increase her earnings.

She contributes to household expenses and helps her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other products to sell.

loans.name: Tursunboi

texts.ru: Турсунбой честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Жена занимается торговлей и продает платки на центральном рынке города. Турсунбой приобретает крупный рогатый скот на рынке, а затем в течении 2-3 недель откармливает их и заново продает за выгодную цену. В бизнесе помогают сыновья. Имеет хороший доход от бизнеса и данный момент имеет несколько  голов мелкого рогатого скота. Запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Tursunboi is an honest and hardworking man. He is married and is raising three children. He has been reselling large horned cattle for more than ten years. His wife does sales and sells scarves on the central market of the town. Tursunboi buys large horned cattle on the market, then fattens it for two to three weeks and resells for a more profitable price. His sons are helping him in the business. He has a good income from this business and at this time has several heads of small horned cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle with the goal to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Gaffor

texts.ru: Более 15 лет Гаффор занимается купле- продажей сладостей. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Его качественные личные черты в том, что он очень добрый и трудолюбивый человек. В бизнесе помогаю жена и дети. Гаффор хочет расширить ассортимент продуктов, чтобы привлечь много новых клиентов. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 6000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gaffor has been reselling sweets for more than fifteen years. He is married and is a responsible father of four children. His best personal qualities are that he is a kind and hardworking man. His wife and children help him in the business. Gaffor wants to expand the assortment of his merchandise to attract more new customers. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,000 somini with this purpose. He hopes for your helps and kindness.

loans.use: to buy sweets in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en: Ninh is 54 years old with two children who are grown. Being a tailor, she opened a tailor shop. Her business started three years ago and creates good income for managing her family life. Joining in our credit program in 2010, she used loans to expand her shop. For her new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy fabric to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making dresses and trousers

loans.name: Sojidamo

texts.ru: Сочидамо жительница района Хамадони. Ей 61 год. Она замужем. У него двое детей. Она арендует торговую точку в ювелирном магазине. Сочидамо занимается торговлей золотых ювелирных изделий. Кредит берет для покупки золотых национальных украшений.
texts.en: Sojidamo is a resident of the Hamadoni region. She is 61 years old, married and has two children. She rents out a vendor space in a jewelry store. Sojidamo sells gold jewelry products. She is taking out the loan to buy traditional gold jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase traditional gold jewelry.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 28 years old and married with one child. She runs a printing shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a printing machine.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 49 years old, a business man. He is married to Jacinta, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loans successfully. Anthony will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a 32 year old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 8. 2 of the children go to school. 

Severina runs a food store business. He has been in the business for 3 years. He has no employees. Severina heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s word of mouth promotion, done in the market and he also read it from sign post. He is taking a loan of 1500 to purchase more items like, salt, tomato sauce, nomi, tea leaves, soap and many items. Other than this business, Severina has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Severina would like to hope for a big business at list in a good building. His major challenges include the high standard of living in Juba. Severina says that he is giving thanks for Finance Sudan for also considering men for the loans. He is happy.

loans.use: to purchase more items like, salt, tomato sauce, nomi, tea leaves, soap and many items.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet is 35 years old. She has 3 children who are of school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice for wine making. Besides this, she uses side products as food for raising pigs. Her business started many years ago and she gets her main income from these activities. Joining in our credit program in 2010, she used loans to invest in her farming activities. For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy rice for wine making.

loans.use: to buy rice for making wine.

loans.name: Loc

texts.en: Loc is 41 years old with three children who are grown. She is managing a shop that serves fast food like beef noodles for breakfast and lunch. Her business started three years ago. Participating in our credit program in 2010, she used loans to buy more equipment. For her new loan, she wants to  have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy fresh food and some kitchen tools.

loans.use: to buy fresh food and some kitchen tools

loans.name: Sop Mame Cheikh Mbaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Cheikh Mbaye est créé le 27 décembre 2010, il est constitué de cinq femmes qui sont amies et habitent le même quartier; leur activité principale est le commerce. 
La responsable Woury est  âgée de de 27 ans elle est mariée mère de trois enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de produits cosmétiques elle a une bonne expérience d'à peu près deux ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo (c'est la plus petite)

Elle achète ses produits dans une grande ville et revend dans sa boutique au marché central.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant des produits de qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Cheikh Mbaye solidarity group was founded on December 27, 2010. The group is comprised of 5 women who are friends and who live in the same area.

Their main activity is business.

The person in charge, Woury, is 27 years old, married, and is a mother of three children. 

She has cosmetics sales business with about two years good experience

In the photo, she is standing at right (she’s the shortest).

She buys her products in a big city and resells in her boutique in the central market

This loan will allow her to strengthen her business by buying high-quality products to satisfy her clients. 

She contributes to household expenses while increasing her level of savings.

loans.use: buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Omonjon

texts.ru: Омончон житель города Худжанд. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он предоставляет услугу, развозит пассажиров по маршруту №2. В этой области он работает десять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Omonjon is a resident of the town of Khujand. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He provides a taxi service and transports passengers on the route #2. He has been working in this field for ten years. He is taking out the loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Inti, es casada, se dedica a la venta de papa, carbón, que lo lleva a la selva para vender, gracias a Finca Perú y los ingresos que ha tenido de su negocio ha podido construir su casa y educar a sus hijos en la universidad, le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque aprecia y agradece por las capacitaciones recibidas, porque le ayudan a mejorar como persona y le enseña a sus hijos. el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su negocio como papa y carbón para llevar a la selva a vender.
texts.en:
Viviana is married and a member of the Inti Communal Bank. She sells potatoes and charcoal, and travels into the jungle to sell her products. Thanks to Finca Peru and the income that she has earned from her business, Viviana has been able to build a house and educate her children in college. 

She enjoys and appreciates the communal bank meetings, and is grateful for the training she receives. The training helps her improve as a person and she teaches this to her children. Viviana is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business such as potatoes and charcoal that she can sell in the jungle.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and charcoal

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Inti, tiene 30 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, es socia de FINCA Perú ya mas de 3 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propia casa, gracias Finca Perú se pudo comprar su refrigeradora y otros artefactos, ahora esta ahorrando para poder implementar su negocio, le gusta venir a las reuniones por que se distrae y le enseña a ser mejor como persona y como negociante, el préstamo que solicita  lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos para variar su tienda.
texts.en:
Julia, 30, is a member of the Inti Communal Bank. She is single with no children, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 3 years. She sells groceries at home, and thanks to Finca Peru she was able to buy a refrigerator and other equipment for her business. She is currently saving to be able to manage her business. 

Julia enjoys attending the meetings as they interest her and teach her how to be a better person and businesswoman. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil and other products to add variety to her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Luis le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas. Solicita el préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar las protecciones. Para que su casa esta más segura y protegida ya que ha sido victima de robos y desea asegurar el patrimonio de sus hijos. 
Don Luis es empleado de una compañía de trasportes y los fines de semana se dedica a las ventas de comida que es tamales y chocolate caliente en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Con el ingreso que obtiene de su emplea pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Luis' home needs protective grilles on the windows and doors.  He is requesting this loan as he doesn't have the money he needs to pay the person who will carry out this work.  The work will make his home safer and better protected as he has already been a burglary victim and he would like to secure his children's inheritance.  

Luis works for a transport company and, on the weekends, he sells tamales and hot chocolate in different parts of the city.  He will repay his loan from the income he makes from his job.

loans.use: to install protective grilles on his doors and windows

loans.name: Doris Elisa

texts.es: Doris Elisa es una emprendedora que ha creado su propia herramienta de trabajo para salir adelante, que es la venta de mercadería en general lo cual se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general nos expresa la emprendedora que gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado ha aumentado su mercadería y sus clientes está satisfecho por la variedad de productos. Actualmente la emprendedora  está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de variedad de producto como ropa, sandalias, camisas, blusas, variedad de cosméticos entre otros productos que mas demanda sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doris Elisa is an entrepreneur who has created her own way of succeeding, which is selling general merchandise. She has previously received financial support for the purchase of merchandise. She is thankful for the support she has received, which has allowed her to supply her business with merchandise and her customers are satisfied with the variety of products. 

Currently, Doris Elisa is requesting funding for the purchase of a variety of products such as clothing, shoes, shirts, blouses, a variety of cosmetics and other products that her customers demand.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, shirts, blouses, a variety of cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: Perseverancia, iniciativa y deseo de desarrollo por salir adelante son parte de las características primordiales de la alcancía comunal SANTA MARIA, conformado por 11 integrantes en su mayoría mujeres desde hace mas de 2 años, este grupo viene trabajando de forma pareja y en constante desarrollo, cada integrante en forma individual, muestra de ello es la señora Genoveva de 52 años de edad casada y con 4 hijos de los cuales uno aun es menor de edad. Ella se levanta todas las mañanas muy temprano para abrir el bazar que tiene como fuente de ingresos para su hogar, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones a lo largo de 20 años que es el tiempo que tiene su negocio. La señora Genoveva emprende este negocio gracias a la ayuda de su esposo ya que necesitaba un sustento para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Con el reciente préstamo implementara mercadería en compra de útiles escolares. Como la señora Genoveva cada integrante tiene una historia en particular con buenos y malos momentos a lo largo de sus vidas pero, si en algo coinciden es el deseo de superación que demuestran todos los días por el bienestar de sus familias y negocios.
texts.en:
Perseverance, initiative and a desire to make progress and get ahead in life are some of the main characteristics shared by the members of the "Santa Maria" community bank.  This bank has 11 members, mostly women, who have been working together for more than two years.  

52-year-old Genoveva is married and has four children, one of whom is not yet an adult.  Genoveva gets up very early every morning to open her store which is a source of income for her household.  It has given her a lot of satisfaction over the 20 years she has been running it.  Genoveva set up this business with the help of her husband as he needed support in order to provide for their family.  With her loan, Genoveva will stock her business with merchandise, buying school supplies.  In common with Genoveva, every member of this group has their own story, with good and bad moments throughout their lives.  However, if they have one thing in common, it is their desire to do well for the sake of their families and their businesses and they demonstrate this desire every day.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Mi Progreso de San José, tiene 36 años, es madre de 3 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años, es casada, se dedica a la venta de queso, por ahora esta incrementando su negocio trae queso por mayor, quiere hacer su casita de material noble, esta ahorrando para lograr construir su casa, esta educando a sus hijos, le gusta las reuniones porque le gusta socializar con las demás socias y los préstamos ya que le dan con facilidad. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en compra de queso y en la siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the 'Mi Progreso de San José' community bank.  She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  Vilma's business is selling cheese.  Right now, she is increasing her business by buying cheese wholesale.  She would like to build her small house from solid building materials.  She is saving up to build her house and is educating her children.

Vilma enjoys the meetings because she likes to socialize with the other members and she likes the loans because they are easy to obtain.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying cheese and in sowing potatoes.

loans.use: to buy cheese wholesale

loans.name: Serigne  Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Mamadou est âgé de 33 ans et habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. C’est un homme   marié  qui  évolue dans le secteur du transport et pratique l’activité de chauffeur. En meme temps il s’adonne au commerce de  produits divers  et a l’aviculture. Il a une expérience de 15 ans dans son activité. Ses revenus lui permettent d’arrondir les fins de mois. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2002. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs qu’il compte investir dans le commerce de la  friperie  afin de diversifier davantage son activité.
texts.en:
Serigne Mamadou is 33 years old and married and lives in a locality in Senegal. He works in the transport sector as a driver. He also sells a variety of products and practices aviculture. He has been working for 15 years and his income enables him to make ends meet.

Serigne Mamadou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since July 2002. He is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs which he plans to invest in a second-hand clothing business, in order to diversify his activities further.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio de 26 años, convive con Benice con quien tiene 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 1 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Claudio es hombre que no descansa, que mantiene una actitud emprendedora y persistente ante cualquier eventualidad. Es así que empezó a trabajar la tierra con sus padres y ahora que ya cuenta con su propia familia, también se dedica a ello. En sus parcelas de terrenos propias que son 4, siembra café, cacao, maíz y plátanos; priorizando el café y el cacao. Gracias a la variedad en sus productos puede generar ingresos para su familia. El  trabajo en el campo es cansado y lo mantiene ocupado todo el año.
Espera con ansias las cosechas de maíz que inician en febrero y las de café que ya estarán listas  a partir de marzo hasta julio. Sus ventas son inmediatas y las expende al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de Pichanaki. Ya sabe con quien negociar y a cuanto. Sus 4 años de experiencia le han permitido identificar a compradores serios. Claudio ampliará sus sembríos adquiriendo más parcelas de terrenos, dentro de 1 año. Sería la segunda vez que Claudio obtendrá un préstamo gracias a su ayuda de MFP. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse contento con su banco comunal llamado “Los Kontonas de Palomar”. Con el dinero que recibiría, podrá sembrar 1 cuadra de café, para ello ya cuenta con las plantitas, por lo tanto pagará a los jornaleros a quienes contratará para la siembra.
texts.en:
26-year-old Claudio lives with Bernice and the couple have three children aged 10, 4 and 1.  This family live in their own home in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Claudio is a man who never rests.  He maintains an entrepreneurial and persistent attitude faced with any eventuality.  He started working the land together with his parents and, now that he has his own family, he also works as a farmer.  Claudio owns four plots of land on which he grows coffee, cacao, corn and bananas, his priority being the coffee and cacao.  Thanks to the variety of crops he grows, he is able to make income for his family.  Farming work is tiring and it keeps him busy all year.

Claudio is anxiously awaiting his corn harvests which begin in February and his coffee harvests which will be ready between March and July.  His sales are immediate.  He sells his crops in the wholesale market in Pichanaki.  He already knows who to trade with and how much to sell for.  His four years of experience have enabled him to identify serious buyers.  Claudio will expand his plantings, acquiring more plots of land within a year.  

This will be the second time that Claudio has received a loan thanks to the help of MFP.  For this reason, he pledges to be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He confirms that he feels happy to belong to his community bank, which is called "Los Kontonas de Palomar".  Claudio will use the money that he receives to sow one 'cuadra' (measurement of agricultural land) with coffee.  He already has the seedlings and will pay the laborers who he will hire to do the sowing.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad con 5 hijos de los cuales 2 son los que la apoyan económicamente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo en el caserío rural de nombre San “Pedrillo Lote 159”  a unos 30 minutos del Dist. Tambogrande, el cual es perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, la misma que esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, por ser una zona rural en la que vive Maximina aun no cuenta con el servicio básico de agua potable contando por ahora solo con el servicio de luz.

Maximina se dedica de lunes a viernes  ala venta de cerveza, chicha de jora y comida en  su propio domicilio en el cual atiende junto a uno de sus hijos, siendo los días sábados, domingos y lunes, los que mas ventas tienen por lo que trabajan desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta altas horas de la tarde, ya contando con cliente fija debido que se preocupan por la buena atención. 


Maximina considera que para seguir creciendo en su negocio es necesario cambiar paredes y arreglar el piso los que últimamente se han deteriorado debido a las constantes lluvias y les genera una mala imagen comercial, y es que en base a sus objetivos a decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con lo que podrá comprar materiales de construcción y todo lo necesario para el mejoramiento de su casa, mencionada inversión le traerá como consecuencia generar una buena imagen y generar mayores ventas con las que podrán cumplir sus objetivos.

Maximina y sus hijos han trabajado desde mucho tiempo atrás por establecer un negocio propio y ahora que lo han logrado están decididos a seguir creciendo en la unión de todos los integrantes de la familia.
texts.en:
Maximina is a 39-year-old mother with five children.  Two of her children support her financially.  She lives in her own home, together with her husband, in the small rural village called 'San Pedrillo Lote 159', 30 minutes from Tambogrande district in Piura province, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  As Maximina lives in a rural area, they still do not have access to the basic service of piped drinking water.  Right now, they only receive electricity.

From Monday to Friday, Maximina sells beer, 'chicha de jora' (a traditional, corn-based drink) and food from her own home.  She works together with one of children. Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays are the days when they make the most sales and so they work from very early in the morning until very late at night.  They have regular customers because they take care to provide good customer service.

Maximina believes that in order to continue growing in her business, it is necessary to replace her walls and repair the floor as they have deteriorated recently owing to the constant rain and they give a bad image of her business.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy building supplies and everything she needs to improve her home.  This investment will enable her to present a better image of her business and make more sales, which will enable her to achieve her goals.

Maximina and her children have worked long and hard to set up their own business and, now that they have managed it, they are determined to continue growing together, uniting all the members of the family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to make some repairs to her house and business

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es: Narcisa Del Socorro es una  emprendedora que se dedica a la destace de cerdo ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocios, sus negocio lo tiene ubicado en sus casa de habitación donde la visitan sus clientes para comprar su producto. Narcisa se le ha apoyo para comprar  productos para que le ofrezcan a sus clientes, la emprendedora nos cuenta que ya tiene varios clientes fijos que la visitan y que está contenta por que va mejorando su calidad  de vida cada día. Actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de cerdos, leña y pago del transporte para brindarle a sus clientes.
texts.en: Narcisa Del Socorro is an entrepreneur whose business is butchering pigs.  She has years of experience in this business.  Her business is located in her home and her customers visit her to buy her products.  Narcisa has received support in buying products to offer to her customers.  She tells us that she has regular customers who visit her and she is happy because she is continually improving her quality of life.  She is requesting this loan to buy pigs and firewood, and to pay transport costs.  This will give her products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs and firewood, and to pay for transport

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 27 ans, mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Missira, Ségou ville. 
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très tôt elle embrassa le commerce de pagnes auprès de sa grande sœur qui vendait des habits et chaussures à Ségou. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle commença à évoluer seule pour faire la même activité. En plus de cette activité qu'elle mène depuis maintenant 15 ans et dans laquelle, elle jouit d’une grande expérience, elle a diversifié son activité en y ajoutant les activités d'achat vente de poissons. Le poisson est très prisé dans l'alimentation malienne et est très apprécié. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois, après 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 1000kg de poudre de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne à Mopti.
Madame Fatoumata vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt,  de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus telle l’embouche.
Son ambition est   de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Madame Fatoumata is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives in a traditional family in Missira, in Ségou  town. As she did not go to school, she started as a retailer at a very young age, selling "pagnes" (African cloth) with her sister, who sold shoes and clothes. After learning the business from her sister for several years, Fatoumata began selling on her own. In addition to this business which she has had for 15 years and benefits from a lot of experience, she diversified her business by starting to buy and sell fish. Fish is highly prized in malian cooking and very well-liked. 

In order to meet customer demand and to increase profits, Fatoumata is asking for a new loan. She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 24 months, with two fully repaid individual loans. This is her third individual loan which will be used to buy 1000 kg of fish powder. She obtains her supplies in Mopti. 
Madame Fatoumata sells for cash and on credit, on a retail basis, to customers who are mostly women. 

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 120,000 CFA francs. With this profit she will be able to repay the loan, and carry out other income-producing activities such as fattening animals. Her goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Yiriwa De Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe yiriwa de Tessito  est créé lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Gnomy,  (debout en sixième position de la gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme et de balais à base de tige de palmier, qu’elle collecte des villages dans sa zone pour les revendre dans les régions. Elle jouit d’une bonne clientèle. 

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en  huile de palme et tige de palmier pour la revente.

Avec les retombés de son activité, elle compte assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Yiriwa De Tessito group was created on the inauguration date of the "banc villageois". It is made up of 13 women who all live in the same area and are principally small retailers.

Gnomy (standing, 6th from left) is the group's leader. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She sells palm oil and brooms made from palm leaves that she gathers from the villages in her territory for resale in the regions.

Gnomy has a healthy customer base and plans to use this loan to restock on palm oil and palm leaves for resale. She will use the income from her business to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Maritza Aracely

texts.es:
