En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 5 De Noviembre, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar rodeada de muchos cerros lo cual brinda un atractivo sin igual.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive  en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella desde hace muchos años se desempeña como empleada pública, pero  también tiene su negocio propio en su casa, ella prepara y vende dulces de todos los sabores y  comida, la cual los realiza bajo pedido ya que estos los utilizan para recepciones y compromisos sociales, entrega a un salón de recepciones  en la ciudad por lo cual todos los fines de semana tiene sus ventas aseguradas, ella viene realizando esta actividad ya por más de 6 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ingredientes necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 10 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '5 de Noviembre' community bank meet in Las Orquídeas, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city has been known for many years as the 'Valley City' because it is surrounded by hills which give it a charm which is second to none.

Here we meet Maritza.  She is 51 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage who are all adults.  One of them still lives at home.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

For many years, Maritza has been working as a civil servant.  However, she also has her own business at home where she prepares and sells different flavors of sweet treats and other food.  She works to order as people buy from her for receptions and social events.  She delivers her goods to a reception hall in the city and so she has guaranteed sales every weekend.  She has been in this business for more than 6 years now and it has done very well.

Maritza is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her food.  She has been a member of her community bank for ten loan cycles and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.  Her goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe de  39 años, convive con Vilma con quien tiene 7 hijos, cuyas edades fluctúan entre 17 y 7 años. Pepe y toda su familia viven en un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa Palomar, en el distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Desde pequeño Pepe se vio rodeado de cafetales y otras plantas en las parcelas de cultivos de sus padres. Ahora se dedica a la agricultura y con gran destreza cultiva café, cacao, plátanos y maíz. Cuenta con 3 cuadras de terrenos, en ellos distribuye sus sembríos de sus productos. 
Le gusta lo que hace, ya que el trabajo en el campo es más libre y obtiene ingresos de acuerdo a como se desenvuelve y como negocia sus frutos.
Para eso tiene que trasladar su producción hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki. Ahí ya lo conocen por sus buenos productos y por lo años que lleva en el negocio. Lo que más vende es el cacao y el café. Los precios de estos productos casi siempre se mantienen y si bajan, no es mucho. Por el contrario, el maíz y plátanos tienden a bajar de precios en temporadas indeterminadas. Ésta sería la segunda vez que Pepe accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Kontonas de Palomar”, y se siente a gusto de formar parte del grupo. Invertirá el dinero de su crédito en el pago de los personales o jornaleros que contratará para que limpien sus cultivos de las malezas que atrofian el crecimiento y brote de sus frutos o granos.
texts.en:
39-year-old Pepe lives with Vilma and they have seven children between the ages of 7 and 17.  Pepe and his family live together in their own home, in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Since he was a young boy, Pepe has been surrounded by coffee plantations and other plants growing on his parents' farmland.  Now he farms himself and, with great skill, he grows coffee, cacao, bananas and corn.  He has three 'cuadras' (measurement of agricultural land) on which he sows his crops.

Pepe enjoys what he does as farm work is less restricting and he makes income according to how he manages his business and how well he negotiates the sale of his crops.  He has to transport his produce to the city of Pichanaki where he is already well known for his good produce and for the number of years he has been in the business.  What he sells the most of is cacao and coffee.  The prices for these products almost always remain stable and if they do fall it isn't by much.  On the other hand, the price of corn and bananas falls during some seasons.  

This will be the second time that Pepe has requested a loan from MFP and so he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  He belongs to the "Los Kontonas de Palomar" community bank and feels happy to be a member.  He will invest his loan money in paying staff or laborers who he will hire to get rid of the crops that stunt the growth and sprouting of his fruit and grains.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Carmita Georgina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 5 De Noviembre, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar rodeada de muchos cerros lo cual brinda un atractivo sin igual.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmita, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 9 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el Oriente en una petrolera.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  zapatos y zapatillas  pero siempre busca lo que este de temporada y tengan más salida, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días ya que vende fuera y en su casa, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la recibe desde los Estados Unidos ya que  le envían desde este país y también compra en Guayaquil. Tiene más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas, blusas, zapatillas, sandalias, entre otras cosas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria y le gusta porque todas sus amigas son muy cumplidas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The communal bank "5 de Noviembre" meets every two weeks in the community of Las Orquídeas in the city of Portoviejo.  The city has been known for a long time as Ciudad del Valle (city of the valley) because it is surrounded by many hills that give it a unique attractiveness.

Here is where we meet Carmita, 33, who is married and has three children, aged 16, 9 and 3.  The eldest is in high school and the middle child in elementary school.  Her husband works for an oil company out east.

She sells all kinds of clothing, shoes, and sport shoes, but is always seeking seasonal items which are in high demand.  She sells door-to-door and also receives customers at home when she has new merchandise.  She works every day and sells on a credit basis, collecting payment weekly.  She receives merchandise from the United States and also buys in Guayaqil.  For over 15 years she has been in business and it has been quite successful.

This loan is to buy bermudas, swimsuits, t-shirts, blouses, sport shoes, sandals, and other items.  She is a founding member and acting secretary of her communal bank which she likes because all her friends are very reliable.

Her dream is to have her own clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy bermudas, swimsuits, t-shirts, blouses, sport shoes, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Takou Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takou Liguey est crée le 21 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de 13 femmes toutes exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 
Debout à droite et levant la main, Fatou est la responsable du groupe. Elle est agée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont un en charge.
Avec son prêt, elle va acheter des tissus pour la confection de pagnes et habits.
Les recettes de son activité lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The Takou Liguey solidarity group was created on the 21st of December 2009. It is composed of 13 women who are all small retailers.

Fatou, standing on the right with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 5 children, one of whom is in her care. She will use her part of the loan to buy fabrics with which to make pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric) and other clothing. The takings from her business will enable her to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric with which to make clothing for resale.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Una alcancía con muchos deseos de superación y ganas por salir adelante, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal Solidaridad De Jicamarca, el cual lleva ese nombre ya que, así se llama el lugar donde viven los integrantes del grupo. Esta alcancía está conformada por 6 integrantes en su mayoría mujeres,  cada integrante  con una historia de vida y de superación personal a lo largo de sus vidas.  Una integrante en particular es la señora Julia de 36 años de edad conviviente y madre de tres hijos que uno ya es mayor de edad y los otros dos están a su cuidado, la señora Julia se dedica al tejido y acabados de chompas de hilo y que también  eventualmente realiza tejidos a pedido. Comienza en este negocio a raíz, que trabajo en una fábrica de chompas. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y el apoyo de su conviviente han  podido construir el segundo piso de su casa y con el pasar del tiempo darse una mejor calidad de vida. El reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para comenzar con los pedidos que tiene de chompas. En el futuro le gustaría poner el negocio de ferretería y  poder generar más ingresos económicos para ella y su familia.
texts.en: The members of the 'Solidaridad de Jicamarca' have a great desire to do well and make progress.  The bank is named after the town where its members live.  The group has six members, mainly women, and each member has a life story and a story of how they have improved themselves throughout their lives.  One member in particular is 36-year-old Julia who lives with her partner and has three children.  One of her children is already an adult and the other two are still in her care.  Julia's business is knitting and finishing off sweaters.  She also occasionally makes woven products to order.  She started out in this business as she used to work in a sweater factory.  Through the effort of her work and the support of her partner, Julia has been able to build a second floor on her home and, over time, enjoy a better quality of life.  She will invest this loan in buying yarn so that she can begin filling the orders that she has for sweaters.  In the future, she would like to set up a hardware business to make more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Ghawakil De Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ghawakil  de Tessito  est créé lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier, ces dernières mènent toutes des activités commerciales. Ce groupe est très organisé avec un bon système de communication.

Madame  Aramata,  (debout à l’extrême droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, de même elle a en charge 03 proches parents venus poursuivre leurs études. 

Elle est une vendeuse de légumes dans de sa localité, cette activité elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des légumes auprès des producteurs  pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise, en plus de participer à la prise en charge des enfants, elle désire construire un habitat plus moderne.
texts.en:
The Ghawakil de Tessito group was created on the inauguration date of the "banc villageois". It is made up of 15 women who all live in the same area and all undertake commercial activities. The group is very organised and has a good communication system in place.

Aramata (standing on the far right) is the group's leader. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She is also responsible for 3 close relatives who have come to the area to continue their studies. She sells vegetables in her local district and has done so for several years.

Aramata will use this loan to buy vegetables from the producers, for resale. As well as using the profits from her business to cover the children´s needs, she would also like to build a more modern house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables from producers for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 5 De Noviembre, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar rodeada de muchos cerros lo cual brinda un atractivo sin igual.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Beatriz, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 16 y 3 años de edad, los mayores estudia en Universidad y el menor  en escuela. Su esposo es policía.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Esika, Lebel y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana,  de dos a tres horas diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que  son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 8 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank "5 de Noviembre" meets every two weeks in the community of Las Orquídeas in the city of Portoviejo. The city has been known for a long time as Ciudad del Valle (city of the valley) because it is surrounded by many hills that give it a unique attractiveness.

It is here where we meet Mrs. Beatriz, 37, who is married and has three children, aged 18, 16 and 3.  The eldest go to university and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a policeman.

She is a homemaker who earns an extra income to help her husband cover household expenses by selling clothing by catalogue as well as Esika, Lebal and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works three days a week, two to three hours a day.  She sells on a credit basis and collects payment every eight days.  For ten years she has been in business and it has been quite successful.  The products she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics because they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and lingerie.  She has been a member of the communal bank for eight loan cycles and she likes it because of the easy payment terms.

Her goal is to own a boutique.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and lingerie.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza, tiene la edad de 50 años, es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con ella, es viuda, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años donde anteriormente estuvo 3 años retirándose un tiempo por problemas personales y ahora esta ya 1 año en el BC Bonanza.
Graciela tiene su tienda en su propia casa donde vende abarrotes, gracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo llenar su tienda, con lo cual esta educando a sus hijos y pudo tambien ampliar mas su tienda, le gusta las reuniones por que se entretiene con las demás socias, les enseñan sobre la puntualidad y otras cosas que le sirve para  mejorara en su negocio. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en compra de abarrotes por sacos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, y otros.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of 'Bonanza' community bank.  She is 50 years old and the mother of seven children, only two of whom still live with her.  Graciela is a widow.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years in all.  She was previously a member for three years but withdrew for a while due to personal problems  She has most recently been a member for one year, belonging to 'Bonanza' community bank.

Graciela has a store in her own home where she sells groceries.  Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to fill her store.  As a result, she is educating her children and has also been able to expand her store.  She likes the meetings because she enjoys herself with her fellow group members.  They are taught punctuality and other things which help them to improve in their businesses.  Graciela is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying groceries such as bags of rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: El cliente es originario  de la provincia ichilo del departamento de Cochabamba, y actualmente vive cerca de la comunidad de manco kapac de entre ríos, también cuenta con una parcela agrícola donde desarrolla su actividad, ahora se le está  presentando la oportunidad para poder realizar siembra de  arroz mecanizado, cerca de su parcela y para dicha inversión solicita el presente crédito con la institución. El cliente es responsable y con muchas ganas de seguir superándose día a día. Su actual ingreso que tiene el cliente es de la producción y venta de plátano, y con el arroz está diversificando sus ingresos y disminuir el riesgo de algunas plagas que puede haber en el sector. También recalcar que el cliente tiene muchas expectativas a futuro y muy positivas. Tiene una experiencia de 4 años en el sector donde está trabajando. Con el apoyo de sus padres el cliente ha logrado independizarse en su actividad.
texts.en: The borrower is from the Ichilo Province in the department of Cochabama, but he currently lives in the Manco Kapac community in Entre Ríos.  He has a patch of land where he grows crops, and now he has the opportunity to plant mechanized rice near his land.  He is requesting a loan from the institution for this investment.  He is responsible and determined to get ahead on a daily basis.  He earns a living growing and selling bananas, and the rice will be used to diversify his income and reduce the risk of plant disease in the industry.  He has four years' experience in the sector and many positive goals for the future.  He has become an independent farmer with the support of his parents.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor de 40 años convive con Carmen, la madre de sus 7 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre los 14 y 4 años. Ésta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Héctor se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño, exactamente desde los 13 años, gracias a sus conocimientos ahora se desenvuelve con facilidad y destreza en sus propios terrenos. Son 4 parcelas las que administra y trabaja sembrando plátanos, café, maíz, yuca, cacao y arroz.
Actualmente negocia con inteligencia toda su producción en la ciudad de Pichanaki, y si tiene suerte, los mismos compradores se dirigen hacia su comunidad para adquirir, principalmente el café, de esa manera se ahorra en el pago de los fletes.
“El café es muy rentable, cada kilo lo vendo a 8 soles, en febrero y marzo,  pero hay meses en que sube hasta 13, eso es en abril y mayo”.
Héctor está contento con su producción y sus logros, por que todo lo que obtiene es fruto de su esfuerzo y perspicacia. Sus ventas son buenas, por eso, una de sus metas a corto plazo es adquirir un automóvil para desplazarse y trasladar sus productos. Sería una buena inversión. Sería la segunda vez que Héctor obtendrá un préstamo gracias a su ayuda de MFP. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse contento con su banco comunal llamado “Los Kontonas de Palomar”. Con el dinero podrá extender sus sembríos de café, renovando o sembrando nuevas plantitas. Además pagará el servicio del personal operario a quien contratará para esta actividad.
texts.en:
40-year-old Héctor lives with Carmen, the mother of his seven children who are between 4 and 14 years of age.  This family live in their own home, in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Héctor has been farming since he was a child, from the age of 13.  Thanks to his knowledge, he now carries out his farming work on his own land with ease and skill.  He has four plots of land where he grows bananas, coffee, corn, cassava, cacao and rice.

Héctor currently trades all his crops wisely in the city of Pichanaki and, if he is lucky, the buyers come to his community to acquire his crops (mainly the coffee).  This saves him having to pay for transport.

"Coffee is very profitable.  I sell each kilo for 8 soles in February and March, but there are months in which the price rises to 13 soles, in April and May".

Héctor is happy with his production and his achievements.  Everything he obtains is the fruit of his efforts and shrewdness.  His sales are good.  One of his short-term goals is to buy a car so that he can travel and transport his produce.  It would be a very good investment.

This will be the second time that Héctor has obtained a loan thanks to the help of MFP.  For this reason, he pledges to make his monthly repayments on time.  He says that he feels happy to belong to his community bank which is called 'Los Kontonas de Palomar'.  Héctor will use his loan money to extend his coffee plantings, renewing or sowing new seedlings.  He will also pay staff who he will hire for this job.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes

loans.name: Ana Maribell

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 5 De Noviembre, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar rodeada de muchos cerros lo cual brinda un atractivo sin igual.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 40 años  de edad, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque con los créditos le han recibido mucha ayuda para salir adelante.

Ella con la finalidad de obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y para sus propios gastos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Sayson y  Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas  diarias,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días.  La ropa  se la envían  desde los Estados Unidos,  tiene más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien además que nos dice que le encanta vender ya que además de ganarse su sustento se divierte en sus recorridos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son  comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "5 de Noviembre" meets every two weeks in the community of Las Orquídeas in the city of Portoviejo. The city has been known for a long time as Ciudad del Valle (city of the valley) because it is surrounded by many hills that give it a unique attractiveness.

Here is where we meet Mrs. Ana, 40, who is single and lives with her parents.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and is the acting president.  She likes it because the loans she has received have helped her get ahead greatly.

In order to have her own income and help her parents cover household expenses she sells all kinds of clothing as well as Sayson and Lebel brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day, two to three hours, and sells on a credit basis, collecting payment every eight days.  She receives the clothes from the United States, and has been in business successfully for over 15 years.  She enjoys what she does not only because she earns an income, but also because she likes going out to sell.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and lingerie.  

Her dream is to buy a car for her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and lingerie.

loans.name: Ruth Yessenia

texts.es: Ruth Yessenia tiene 28 años de edad, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, esta emprendedora tiene 1 hijo que todavía está a su cargo y lucha día a día para brindarle lo mejor, su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante, ya tiene clientes fijos que le ofrece sus productos. Este negocio lo emprende de la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia, pero se enamore de el y lo realiza con gran dedicación. Ruth Yessenia está solicitando crédito para comprar variedad de productos como ropa para damas y caballeros, pantalones, camisa, blusa, sandalias y cosméticos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Ruth Yessenia is 28 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  This entrepreneur has one son who is still in her care and she works hard every day to provide him with the best in life.  She carries out her business as an itinerant vendor and already has regular customers to whom she offers her products.  She started this business because she needed to make income for her family but she fell in love with it and now carries it out with great commitment.  Ruth Yessenia is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products such as ladies' and men's clothing, pants, shirts, blouses, sandals, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, sandals, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Virgilio

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 43 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su fabricación de rejas y puertas. 

Su historia comenzó a los 16 años su papa lo envió a un curso de soldador después se quedo trabajando en la cemento por 10 años para después poner su propio taller, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, si tiene dificultades son las enfermedades la salud de sus hijos, si esta casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, si tiene 2 hijos menores de 10 y 7 años estudian en fiscal.

Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su fabricación de rejas y puertas y comprar metal para hacer mas puertas.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 43-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business over the next few years.  His business is making grilles and doors.

Pedro's business story started when he was 16 years old and his dad sent him on a welding course.  He ended up working in the cement business for 10 years and then set up his own workshop.  He carries out his work alone every day, from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  The difficulties he faces are illnesses and his children's health.  Pedro is married and his wife takes care of their home.  He has two children who are 10 and 7 years old and studying in a state school.

Pedro's dream is to improve his children's quality of life.  He would like this loan for making grilles and doors.  He will buy metal with which to make more doors.

loans.use: to buy metal and iron

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina tiene 63 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad quienes son económicamente independientes, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo en.  
La casa en la que vive esta ubicada en una zona rural de nombre “CP-8 Malingas” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande, en la provincia de Piura a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Caserío el cual por ahora no cuentan aun con servicios básicos de agua potable y servicio de luz eléctrica.


Jovina se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado menor, como: ovinos, porcinos, y aves de corral en su mayoría, en la actualidad cuenta con una gran cantidad de animales los cuales ha criado y engordado con gran esfuerzo, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la relación que existe con sus hijos y esposo y demás familiares es muy bueno debido a que le ha permitido aprender este negocio desde muy pequeña, en su deseo de mejor su calidad de vida es que ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos.

Jovina destinará el crédito para la compra de alimentos balanceados para su  engorde y posterior comercialización de sus animales en los mercados locales y aledaños a su caserío, para lo que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles. 

Jovina cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por los vecinos que habitan en su caserío.
texts.en:
Jovina, 63, is the mother of four adult children who are economically independent.  She lives in her own house with her husband in a rural area known as "CP-8 Malingas" which belongs to the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is about three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  For now the community does not even have basic utilities such as drinking water or electricity.

Jovina raises small animals such as sheep, pigs and chickens.  She has many animals now which she has worked hard caring for in strategic places she has set up around her house.  Her relationship with her children and husband and other relatives is very good, and has allowed her to learn her trade since she was young.  Her desire for a better lifestyle has been the motive for establishing new family goals which she works hard to accomplish.

Jovina will use the loan to buy balanced feed for her animals which she will sell in the local and nearby markets.  She has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN.

She has good personal and work references from the neighbors in the community.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza, se dedica a la venta de leña, gracias a Finca puede ahorrar y educar a sus hijos, le gusta participar de las reuniones por que aprende a ser responsable, puntual, como progresar en su negocio y mejorar como persona y con su familia, su sueño es construir su casa donde para eso esta empezando a ahorrar, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña para vender.
texts.en: Teodosia is a member of the 'Bonanza' community bank.  Her business is selling firewood.  Thanks to FINCA, she is able to save and educate her children.  She enjoys taking part in meetings because she learns to be responsible and punctual.  She also learns how to make progress in her business, how to improve as a person and how to improve her family relationships.  Her dream is to build her own home and she is starting to save for this.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 40 años convive con Juana, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 9 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, en el distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Pedro es un hombre agricultor, con experiencia dentro de las labores del campo. Con la convicción que lo caracteriza se dedica a la producción de café, cacao y maíz.  Hace 3 años que inició las cosechas del cacao y le va muy bien, siendo ahora, el fruto que más ingresos le genera. “De media cuadra de cacao cosechó 2000 kilos, cada kilo lo vendo a 5 soles, si me conviene”, afirma.
El café también es otro producto que le brida buenas satisfacciones. No se puede quejar. Toda su cosecha las comercializa con inteligencia en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que tiene que incluir en el precio, el servicio del traslado que paga por movilizar su abundante cosecha hasta la ciudad. 
Pedro tiene sus metas claras, ahora ampliará sus sembríos de cacao, para eso arrendará una parcela ubicada a varios minutos de su vivienda. Sería la segunda vez que Pedro accedería a un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, como lo fue anteriormente. Está satisfecho de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Los Kontonas de Palomar” y agradece de antemano las oportunidades de desarrollo.
Destinará el dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para que realicen la limpieza de sus cultivos. Además comprará nuevas herramientas como machetes para facilitar este trabajo.
texts.en:
40-year-old Pedro lives with Julia and the couple have two children who are 13 and 9 years old.  The family live in their own home, in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Pedro is a farmer and has experience in this line of work.  With characteristic conviction, he carries out his work producing coffee, cacao and corn.  He started growing cacao three years ago and it is doing very well.  It is now the crop that makes him the most income.  "From half a 'cuadra' (measurement of agricultural land) of cacao, I harvested 2,000 kilos.  I sell each kilo for 5 soles which I am happy with", he says.

Coffee is another product that gives Pedro a lot of satisfaction.  He cannot complain.  He sells all his harvested crops wisely in the city of Pichanaki.  He has to include in the price the transport service that he must pay for in order to haul his abundant harvest to the city.  Pedro has clear goals in mind.  Right now, he would like to expand his cacao plantings.  He will rent a plot of land a few minutes from his home for this purpose. 

This will be the second time that Pedro has taken out a loan from MFP.  He pledges to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loan. He is happy to belong to his community bank which is called 'Los Kontonas de Palomar' and would like to give thanks in advance for the opportunities to make progress.  Pedro will use his money to pay laborers who he will hire to weed his crops.  He will also buy new tools such as machetes to make this work easier.

loans.use: to pay laborers and to buy tools such as machetes

loans.name: Frey

texts.es:
Frey de 27 años, convive con Marushka con quien tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa Palomar, en el distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Frey, joven pero con muchas fuerzas, comenta que se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño. Aprendió las labores del campo gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Ahora, que ya cuenta con su propia familia, administra las 3 parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad le otorgó, en ellas siembra abundante cacao y café, que son su prioridad. Además de, plátanos, cuyos ingresos lo sacan de apuros gracias a su cosecha semanal.
El cacao es un producto que favorece a los agricultores de su zona, por tener el clima y los suelos óptimos. Frey se preocupa más por los cuidados y atenciones, como son la esparcimiento de abonos naturales o guano y la limpieza constante de la maleza que restringe el crecimiento normal de sus plantaciones.
Frey tiene 2 hijos menores y por ellos trabaja como lo hace. Es un padre ejemplar. Con el tiempo conseguirá más terrenos, ya sea por compras o arrendamientos, en los que sembrará más cacao. Ésta sería la segunda vez que Frey accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Kontonas de Palomar”, y se siente a gusto de formar parte del grupo. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mamones de plátanos para iniciar con otra siembra. Además abrirá una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Frey is 27 years old. He lives with Marushka with whom he has 2 children aged 5 and 3. This family lives in their own home in the indigenous community of Palomar, in the district of Río Negro, province of Satipo. Frey, a young man with a lot of strength, says that he has worked in farming since he was  little. He learned the work thanks to what his parents taught him. Now that he has his own family, he manages 3 parcels of land that his community granted him. There he grows abundant cacao and coffee, that are his priority. He also grows plantains, whose income gets him out of trouble, thanks to the weekly harvest. 

Cacao is a favorable product for the area farmers, because they have optimal soils and climate. Frey worries the most about the care and attention, like the spreading of natural fertilizer or guano and the constant clearing of weeds that restrict the normal growth of his crops. 

Frey has 2 minor children and he works like he does for them. He is an exemplary father. In time, he will obtain more land either by purchasing or renting, where he will plant more cacao. This will be the second time that Frey will access an MFP loan, and that is why he is committed to being punctual with his payments. He belongs to the “Los Kontonas de Palomar” communal bank and he likes being a part of the group. With the money from the loan, he will but plantain plants to begin another crop. He will also open a small grocery store in his own store.

loans.use: to buy plantain plants, as well as open a small grocery store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza, tiene la edad de 40 años, no tiene hijos, es casada, su profesión es de administración, por ello administra su propia ferretería, en el poco tiempo que esta en Finca Perú le gusta  las capacitaciones por que le enseñan a mejorar en lo personal y en lo que es el negocio como administrar su ganancia y como distribuirlas, también le han enseñado a ahorrar, se siente bien porque le brindan apoyo a las personas que lo necesitan. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de material eléctrico como cables, focos, interruptores para su negocio.
texts.en: Patricia is a member of the 'Bonanza' community bank.  She is 40 years old, married, and doesn't have any children.  She manages her own hardware store.  During the short time that she has been a member of FINCA Peru, she has enjoyed the training sessions which teach her to improve herself and, on the business side of things, teach her how to manage her profits and how to distribute them.  They have also taught her how to save.  She feels happy because they give support to people who need it.  Patricia is requesting this loan to invest in buying electrical supplies such as cables, light bulbs and switches for her business.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies such as cables, light bulbs and switches

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Javier , es un pequeño comerciante , gracias al apoyo que lebrinda Afodenic , a logrado establecer su negocio de frutas y verduras ; ya que es su fuente de ingresos economicos para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar , ahora el necesita que se le apoye para comprar de una solo vez cosechas de la temporada ya que si esto lo logra puede obtener mejores ganacias y asi podrá ir mejorando aun mas su negocio .Su major sueño es poderle mejorar la vivienda a su mamá para que viva dignamente .
texts.en: Young Javier is a small businessman.  Thanks to the support that he has received from Afodenic, he has managed to establish his fruit and vegetable business.  This is his source of income with which he supports his family in covering the household expenses.  He now needs support so that he can make a bulk purchase of seasonal harvests as this will enable him to make better profits and thereby continue improving his business.  Javier's biggest dream is to improve his mom's home so that she can live decently.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is fifty-six years old with three grown children. She is a retail seller, and runs a small fresh fruits shop in the local market. Her business started three years ago and it creates good income for her family. 

Joining in our credit program in 2010, she used her loans to invest in her fruit shop. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more fruit to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a mother of eight children aged between three months and twenty-four years old. Except the youngest child, all the children go to school. 

Jacqueline sells charcoal and has spent five years in the same business. Based on her previous experience in this business she has requested the loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Phong

texts.en:
Phong is forty-eight years old with one grown son. She is a farmer, and grows rice and raises chickens. She began her chicken-raising two years ago, and she gets a good income from it. 

Phong joined our credit program in 2010, and used her loans to expand her chicken-raising business. Curently, she wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco, tiene la edad de 72 años, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo 2 hijos viven junto con ella, es casada, tiene mas de 15 años como socia en Finca Perú, se dedica a la venta de ropa, sombreros, mantas; en el tiempo que estuvo en Finca logró muchas cosas, pudo educar bien a sus hijos con los ahorros que tenia, en lo personal le ayudó mucho por que le enseñaron a ser puntual, responsable, y a valorarse como mujer, en cuanto a su negocio también le ayudó mucho, ahora tiene mas dinero para que compre mas mercadería como ropas, le gusta las reuniones por que le gusta encontrarse con sus amigas, y distrae, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en compra de ropas y sombreros para llevar a Ica a vender.
texts.en: Vilma is a member of the Ccori Soncco communal bank. She is 72 years old and has 8 children, 2 of whom live with her. She is married and has been a member of Finca Peru for 5 years. She sells clothes, hats and blankets. During the time she has been with Finca she has achieved many things. She was able to educate her children with the savings she had, and it helped her a lot personally because they taught her to be punctual, responsible and to value herself as a woman. In regards to her business, it helped her a lot. Now she has more money to buy merchandise such as clothing. She likes the meetings because she likes to meet with friends and it's interesting. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying clothes and hats to take to Ica to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and hats.

loans.name: Robai

texts.en:
Robai is a forty-three-year-old business lady, living in Mombasa, and the married mother of three. She operates a cyber-café, a business she has been doing for the past three years.

This is her first business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase a refurbished computer. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to open another cyber-café.

loans.use: to purchase a refurbished computer.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is fifty-three years old and has three grown sons. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises pigs. She started her pig-raising business two years ago, and she gets a good income from it.

Hai joined our credit programme in 2010, and used her loans to expand her pig-raising business. Curently, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a forty-seven-year-old business lady, the single mother of one child. She has been selling fruits in an open air market for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Margaret will use the loan to buy fresh fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits for her business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is fifty-two years old with two children. One of them is of school age. She runs a restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. Her business started three years ago.  

Participating in our credit programme since 2010, Nga has used her loans to buy more equipment. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy fresh food and kitchen tools.

loans.use: to buy fresh food and kitchen tools.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in Air Port Community. Aged thirty-seven, she is married with three children between eight and sixteen. They are in school and live at home. For the past fifteen years now, Elizabeth has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to educate her children and build a house for them.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from the village of Nigoiti. He is 44 years old and lives with his two sons (17 and 13 years old) and his 66-year-old mother. Both children go to school. 

Gia works in a car repairing workshop in the village. He paints cars. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family agricultural business. They have a milk cow and a calf. Gia’s mother produces cheese and sells on average 10 kilos of this product in the village. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns a 7-hectare plot of land, where maize is grown. Gia sells approximately 14 tons of maize to retailers on the local open market. The total average monthly income for the family is 1,200 Laris, including Gia’s mother's monthly pension. 

Gia requested credit for purchasing an additional one hectare of land. He will grow maize on a wider area and will harvest more maize; consequently, the income of the family will increase. Gia plans to use the increased income for financing the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase one hectare of agricultural land.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a forty-four-year-old business lady, who is married to Jeremiah, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Nancy will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en: Bonifride is thirty-one years old. She sells various merchandise in her boutique which she has had for the last four years. She wants the loan to add more merchandise to the same boutique. She thinks this will help her upgrade her business. With the profits, she plans to buy a piece of land for farming. In the future, Bonifride would like to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is fifty-four years old with three children who are grown. She is running a butcher shop that opened two years ago. It creates a good income for her family. 

Hien joined our credit program in 2010, and used the loans to expand her business. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy pigs and raw products.

loans.use: to buy pigs and raw products.

loans.name: Xa

texts.en:
Xa is fifty-eight years old with two grown children. A farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens. Her chicken-raising started a year ago, and she gets a good income from it. 

Xa joined our credit program in 2010, and used her loans to expanding her chicken-raising. Curently, she wants to have a loan of 8,288,000 VND to buy food for her chickens

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en: Dinh is 37 years old with 4 children. Three of them are at school age. She is running a wood workshop that makes family furniture. Her business started 2 years ago. Becoming a client of our credit program in 2010, she finds it suitable for her business. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 40 years old. He lives in the village of Norio in West Georgia with his wife, Shorena, and two children. Gia is a construction worker. He performs house construction and painting in his own and nearby villages. Along with his main job, Gia is involved in family agriculture. They run a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Shorena and Gia produce cheese and sell it to dairy product retailers on the local open market. Also, the family has a plot of land where maize and nut trees are grown. the harvested products are sold locally to the wholesalers. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris. 

Gia requested credit for purchasing fertilizers. After fertilizing the land he will get a better harvest of maize, which will be sold on the local market and bring more income to the family. He will use part of the requested credit for renovating a small part of the house, which is already old and needs fixing up in order to be good for living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his agricultural plot and construction materials for the renovation of part of the house.

loans.name: Wilmer Joel

texts.en: Wilmer is from the community of San Lorenzo, Valle, Honduras. He lives with his wife and two children. For four years he has been making and selling balconies, metal doors, glass windows and sliding doors. He is requesting 20,000 Honduran lempira as working capital because he needs to buy glass and metal to fill a huge order that he has from a customer. He does not have enough raw materials to make these products.

loans.use: to buy glass and metal for his business.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lugano Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been operating a pharmacy business for two years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more medicines. Her dream is to one day own a big pharmacy.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Lugano", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a wholesale business and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, and only two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She operates a beauty salon on a retail basis. She sells her products in a shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last four years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy hair treatments, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges are defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a bridal salon. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair treatments, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with two children, and both of her children go to school. She operates a beauty salon on a retail basis. She sells her products in a shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last four years.  

She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a hair dryer, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges are electricity and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build a house. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of braids, weaves and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Aminata vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 41 ans.. Elle évolue dans le secteur de la couture depuis 4 ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus c’est la création  de modèles  et les rencontres et échanges avec  les gens.  Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis 200.3 et  a déjà remboursé 6 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés à confectionner des habits  à revendre. Son financement lui permet progressivement d’élargir son marché.
texts.en: Mademoiselle Aminata lives in Senegal. She is 41 years old. She has developed her work in sewing over the last four years. This is a business that she chose out of passion. What interests her the most is the creation of patterns and the meetings and exchanges with people. She has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch since 2003 and has already repaid six past loans. She is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs, which she anticipates using to buy fabric to make into clothes to sell. Her financing allows her to progressively enlarge her market.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mamadou Birahim

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou Birahim est âgé de 40 ans. Il habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est peintre de profession  et en meme temps il  pratique le commerce de vaisselles, d’habits de friperie et d’autres produits divers. Il a choisi ses activités dans le but de se procurer des revenus et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les  flux financiers  qui son t générés  par son activité. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu s’approvisionner en vaisselles et acquérir d’autres nouveaux produits qui seront destinés a la vente. Son souhait est d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour bien prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Monsieur Mamadou Birahim is 40 years old. He lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of two children. He is a painter by profession, and at the same time he works selling dishes, second-hand clothes, and other various products. He chose these business activities with the goal of making income and supporting the needs of his family. What interests him the most is the financial flux generated by his business. He has been a member of an UIMCEC branch since November 2011. He is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs, which he anticipates using to stock up on dishes and to acquire new products to sell. His hope is to increase his earnings to take good care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy dishes and to acquire new products to resell.

loans.name: Deego Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Deego est crée le 28 Décembre 2010. Il est composé de 17 femmes toutes issues du même village et exerçant la même activité.

Debout à droite de la photo, et levant la main la responsable Satou est agée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des ovins pour faire une activité d'embouche et commercialiser après. Elle va également acheter de la semence d'arachide, de mil et niébé pour faire de l'agriculture. 

Les recettes générées pas son activité lui permettront d'améliorer les besoins familiaux en matière de nourriture et de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Deego solidarity group was created on December 28, 2010. It is composed of 17 women, all from the same village and practicing the same profession.

Standing up at the right of the photo, and raising her hand is the group leader Satou, who is 55 years old. She is married and mother of one child.

With the loan, she will buy sheep to fatten and market later. She will also buy ground nut seeds, millet, and cowpeas for farming.

The receipts generating by her business allow her to improve her ability to meet her family's needs in terms of feeding her children and sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten, and millet, ground nut, and cowpea seeds.

loans.name: Jappante  Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Jappanté Takku Liggey est créé le 9 juillet 2011, il est constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui ont longtemps travaillé ensemble. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madjiguène la responsable est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants et a en charge un neveu et une nièce; elle s'active dans le petit commerce et le mène depuis plus de 5 ans avec une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à droite habillé en jaune et a levé la main droite.


Elle achéte des parfums, pagnes brodés, encens et perles au marché central de la ville et revend dans son quartier.


Avec son prêt elle compte renforcer son activité.

Elle appui son mari pour la nourriture, l'habillement et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Jappanté Takku Liggey was created on July 9, 2011. It is made up of 15 women who live in the same area and who have worked together for a long time. Their main activity is small business.

Madjiguène, the group leader, is 43 years old, married, mother of four children and has a nephew and niece in her care. She has worked in small business for five years and has good experience. She is standing up on the right (in the photo) dressed in yellow and raising her right hand.

She buys perfumes, embroidered pagnes, incense, and pearls at the central city market and resells them in her area.

With this loan she is going to grow her business.

She supports her husband for the food, clothing and health of the children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and pagnes (colorful wax cloth) to resell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco, tiene la edad de 52 años, tiene 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace mas de 2 años, es casada, se dedica al negocio de ferretería que tiene en su casa, gracias a Finca Perú esta educando a sus hijos, y agracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo comprar su refrigeradora, e incrementar la mercadería de su tienda, antes vendía cereales ahora ya tiene su ferretería, esto lo agradece porque ha sido posible por sus ahorros y los préstamos recibidos y que le dan con facilidad, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de calaminas y clavos.
texts.en: Segundina is a member of the 'Ccori Soncco' community bank.  She is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than two years.  Her business is a hardware store which is located in her home.  Thanks to FINCA Peru, she is educating her children.  Thanks to the loans she has received, she has also been able to buy a refrigerator and increase the merchandise in her store.  She used to sell cereals and now has a hardware store.  She is grateful for this because it was made possible by her savings and the loans that she has received.  The loans are easy to obtain.  Segundina will use the loan that she is requesting to buy sheets of metal and nails.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets wholesale and different types of nails

loans.name: Angel Fernando

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre de 31 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de colas.

Su historia comenzó hace 3 años tenía el negocio de colas y lo mantenía porque la proposición que tenga una entrada más aparte de su trabajo, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días, si tiene dificultades que se dañe la nevera y no tenga colas heladas, no está casado, no tiene hijo

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y tenerlo en un local bien ubicado. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas como jugos y colas.
texts.en:
Ángel is a 31-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business selling Cola over the next few years.

Ángel's business story started three years ago.  He had a Cola business and kept it going so that he would have another income in addition to that from his work.  He works alone every day.  The difficulty he faces is his freezer getting damaged which would mean he wouldn't have any chilled Cola.  Ángel is not married and doesn't have any children.

Ángel's dream is to improve his business and have it in well-located premises.  He would like this loan to buy drinks such as juice and Colas.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 35 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman; they have four children and all of their children are attending school. For twenty-two years now Oretha has been operating a provisions shop where she sells many items such as rice, oil, soap, etc. One of the most inspiring things is that her business helps her earn more money for herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap, etc. for her business. She plans to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, etc. for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and only two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her parents). She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week .

Christine has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has requested for a loan of 650,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into the wholesale business and also to own a delivery  van to ease transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle El Hadji, il est âgé de 40 ans marié et père de famille. Il gère une  boutique de denrées  alimentaires  de puis 8 ans.
Avec le crédit il va renouveler les denrées  qui sont plus rapides à écouler comme le lait, le thé, le sucre en poudre, les bouillons…
Avec  les revenus de ses ventes, El Hadji s’occupe des besoins quotidiens des membres de sa famille. Il voudrait dans  le futur, diversifier  les produits et services.
texts.en:
The borrower is named El Hadji. He is 40 years old, married, and father of a family. He has run a food store for eight years.
With the loan he is going to replace the food items that are the quickest to run out, like milk, tea, granulated sugar, bouillons...
With the revenue from his sales, El Hadji takes care of the everyday needs of his family members. In the future he would like to diversify his products and services.

loans.use: to buy food items: milk, sugar, butter, chocolate, candy.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Sarah sells second-hand clothes door-to-door (on a retail basis). She works seven days a week .She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Sarah's goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and also to get permanent business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Le Chateau Group

texts.fr:
Mme Abzeta est la représentante du groupe LE CHATEAU. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 05 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des condiments (choux, piments, aubergines). Elle exerce ce métier depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Kombissiri village environnant. Ses clients sont les revendeurs, les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter 1/2 sac de poivron, 01 caisse  de tomate fraîche et de piment.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices et investi une partie dans son commerce. Mme ambitionne s’acheter un motocycle pour faciliter son déplacement.
texts.en:
Mme Abzeta is the representative of the group "Le Chateau." She is married and mother of seven children. The oldest is 24 years old and the youngest four years old. Two of her children go to school and she has five people in her care.

Mme Abzeta sells food products (cabbage, sweet peppers, eggplants). She has practiced this trade for 11 years. She stocks up in the surroundings of the village of Kombissiri. Her clients are resellers, women and men.

She wants to buy half a bag of sweet peppers, one crate of fresh tomatoes and hot peppers. 

She saves her profits and invests a part of them back into her business. She aspires to buy herself a motorcycle to help herself get around.

loans.use: to buy herself half a bag of sweet peppers, one crate of fresh tomatoes and hot peppers.

loans.name: Gédéon Plus Group

texts.en:
Ida is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Gédéon Plus,” which is composed of eight microentrepreneurs jointly united to receive loans from Kiva through HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Ida is married and has five children, four of whom attend school.  She earns a living by selling forever products, a business she started in 1998. She sells in  mid-east of Kinshasa. Currently, through her sales, Ida makes about 40% of the sales per month. She is a loyal client of the HOPE RDC and has already received and repaid eight loans. She is requesting her ninth loan, which she will use to increase the inventory of her business. Ida is working hard in order to achieve her dream of someday opening a drugstore.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her goods. i

loans.name: Protoziya

texts.en:
Potanziya is widowed and has six children, four of whom attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda.. She makes fried eatables such as cassava chips, sweet potatoes, and samosas on a retail basis from her home .She works seven days a week and.has been in this  business for 30 years. 

Potanziya is requesting for a loan for 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy cooking oil, raw cassava, cow peas, and baking flour. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her goals are  to educate her children to university level and to see her business expand. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, cow peas, raw cassava, and baking flour.

loans.name: Freddy Enrique

texts.es: El señor Freddy, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, su esposa laboara por cuenta  propia para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar; ya que tienen hijos estudiando , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva ; ya que sin estos programas de apoyo no podria cumplir sus sueños relaidad , ya que logro hacer su vivienda , pero le hace falta el piso el cual no cuanta con muchos recursos economicos para realizar de una sola vez la inversion de piso .
texts.en: Freddy lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his family.  His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions.  His wife works to support him with the household expenses as they have children in school.  Freddy is grateful for the support that Afodenic provide through their Kiva funds because, without these support programs, he wouldn't be able to make his dreams come true. Freddy has managed to build his home but he still needs to lay flooring and doesn't have enough money to buy the supplies he needs in one go.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Isaura Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Isaura, tiene 61 años de edad, es casada hace 40 años, tiene 7 hijos entre las edades de 41 y 22 años los cuales todos son independientes. Vive en el barrio la Ceiba, Tocoa, Colon.
Su actividad económica que le genera ingresos es una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica (arroz, manteca, refrescos, azúcar, galletas, carne, leche, huevos, papel, etc.). Comenzó su negocio desde hace 15 años, trabajando muy duro desde temprano lo que le ha permitido incrementar su inventario y acompañado de una buena administración su negocio le ha sido rentable.
Doña Isaura ha obtenido varios préstamos con Odef, y ahora solicita un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para poder surtir más su negocio en productos de las canastas básicas o alimenticios ya que ahora cuenta con más demanda de clientes.
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Isaura, age 61, has been married for 40 years.  She has seven children between the ages of 41 and 22.  The children are independent.  She lives in the Ceiba neighborhood, Tocoa, Colon.

She has a small grocery store, which generates income for her.  She sells staples like rice, lard, soft drinks, sugar, cookies, meat, milk, eggs, and paper, etc.  She started her business 15 years ago by starting early and working very hard.  This has allowed her to increase her inventory, and together with good administration, her business has been profitable.

Isaura has had various loans with ODEF.  She is now requesting a loan for 20,000 lempiras to be able to stock her store with more staple products or food.  She now has more customer demand.

Her goal is to grow more in her business and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy staples like rice, lard, soft drinks, sugar, cookies, meat, milk, eggs, and paper, etc.

loans.name: Manolo

texts.es:
Manolo de 32 años convive con Lili, con quien tiene 6 hijos de 14, 12, 10, 7, 5 y 2 años. Él y toda su familia viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, en el distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Manolo es un padre y esposo responsable y dedicado. Con su trabajo, que es muy arduo logra mantener a su numerosa familia. La agricultura es su vida y pasión. Cuenta con 5 parcelas de terrenos, todos ellos produciendo café, cacao, maíz y plátanos. Estos frutos le brindan la seguridad de obtener alimentos, vestido y educación para toda su familia, para eso el debe trabajar en el cuidado y mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Ya que, el éxito de sus ventas radica en el tratamiento continúo.
Lili, por su parte se encarga de atender su pequeño negocio instalado en su propio hogar. Ahí ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y heladas. Gracias a estas labores coordinadas cuentan con una estabilidad económica, pero como sus hijos ingresarán a estudiar sus gastos serán mayores. Por eso Manolo piensa comprar otros terrenos para ampliar sus cultivos de café y cacao. Sería el préstamo número 2 que Manolo obtendría, gracias a su ayuda, de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Kontonas de Palomar”. Todos son varones trabajadores y de palabra. Invertirá el dinero en el pago del personal operario que pagará por hacer la limpieza de sus cultivos de café, que se llenan de maleza y mala yerba impidiendo su normal crecimiento.
texts.en:
32-year-old Manolo lives with his partner Lili.  The couple have six children who are 14,12, 10, 7, 5 and 2 years old.  The family live in their own home, in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Manolo is a responsible and devoted father and husband.  Through his work, which is very hard, he manages to provide for his large family.  Farming is his life and his passion.  He has five plots of farmland where he produces coffee, cacao, corn and bananas.  These fruit provide him with the security of obtaining food, clothing and education for his whole family.  He must care for and maintain his crops because the success of his sales lies in him providing them with constant care.

Lili, meanwhile, serves in her small business which is located in their home.  There she sells basic household products, candies, drinks, sodas and iced treats.  Thanks to their joint work, they enjoy financial stability but, as their children start school, their expenses increase.  For this reason, Manolo is planning to buy more land so that he can expand his coffee and cacao plantings.

This will be the second loan Manolo has obtained thanks to the help of MFP.  He pledges to be responsible and punctual in making his repayments.  He belongs to "Los Kontonas de Palomar" community bank whose members are all hard-working, trustworthy men.  Manolo will invest this money in paying workers who he will hire to weed his coffee crops as they are full of weeds which impede their normal growth.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos trabajador, humilde con el préstamo anterior realizo mejoras a su vivienda, en la actualidad tiene su propio negocio permitiendo que su esposa se dedique más a sus hijos y apoyándolo en el negocio. Es una pulpería en donde vende productos variados. Mejor el nivel de vida es su objetivo para ofrecerle mejores alternativa a su familia de progreso. 
Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como: detergente, papel higiénico, jabones de lavar ropa, trasto, cloro, grano básico, café, panes dulce y simple, refresco, gaseosa, jugos, golosina, galletas, carnes, vegetales, lácteos, entre otros productos. 
Agradece a al financiara por el apoyo ya que poco a poco ha logrado surgir con su propio negocio y ofrecerle a su familia mayores comodidades y la oportunidad de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marcos is a hard-working and humble man.  With the previous loan he made improvements to his house.  He now has his own business, which allows his wife to devote more time to their children and support him in the business.

He has a grocery store where he sells various products.  His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living in order to offer them better alternatives for progress.

With this new loan cycle he will buy merchandise like detergent, toilet paper, soap for washing clothes, dish soap, bleach, basic grains, coffee, sweet breads, bread, soft drinks, mineral water, juice, sweets, cookies, meat, vegetables, and dairy products, among others.

He is grateful to the lenders for the support.  Little by little he has managed to establish his own business and offer his family greater comforts and the opportunity for a better future.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, esta mas de 2 años en Finca Perú, es soltera, se dedica a la venta de pollo, se siente orgullosa por que se compro su cosas, también tiene su tienda donde lo implemento con arroz, azúcar, y otros, le gusta la capacitaciones por que les habla de los negocios, de como educar a sus hijos y otras cosa que le sirve en lo personal y en el negocio también con la familia, ella dice que también hace polladas para personas que requieran su servicio para eventos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pollo donde lo prepara para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en: Giovanna is a member of the 'Ccori Soncco' community bank.  She is 29 years old, single, and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than two years.  She feels proud because she has been able to buy her own things.  She also has a store which she has stocked with rice, sugar and other products.  Giovanna enjoys the training sessions because they talk about businesses, how to educate your children and other topics which help in borrowers' personal, family and business lives.  Giovanna says that she also provides 'polladas' (portions of chicken) to people who request her services for events.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying chicken which she will prepare and then sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Merli Layli

texts.es: Merli es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco, tiene la edad de 26 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujeres, ahora tiene su tiendita, esta orgullosa porque esta saliendo adelante sola, gracias a Finca se esta educando sola en un Instituto donde estudia la carrera de contabilidad, también dice que mejoro su negocio por los ahorros y préstamo que ha recibido con facilidad, gracias a ello se ha comprado sus exhibidores y vitrinas, aprendió la puntualidad, responsabilidad y a salir adelante sola, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en compra de ropas, peluches, carteras y accesorios por temporada de día de san Valentín.
