Luz continúa sigue trabajando como profesora en una de las escuela del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco. En esta oportunidad la socia Luz requiere el préstamo para comprar óleo, cola, tela y pinceles. Luz se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa's 'Inti' community bank which is located in Cusco department, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and all the members are doing very well ('Inti' is a Quechuan word for 'Sun').

Luz continues living in the historic city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Most people in the city of Cusco work in tourism-related businesses and services.

Luz continues working as a teacher in a school in San Jerónimo district, in Cusco department.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy oil paints, adhesive, fabric and brushes.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil paints, adhesive, fabric and brushes

loans.name: Yustriyani

texts.en:
Yustriyani is a 47-year-old lady and is married to Yohanes, 53 years old. They are blessed with two daughters: Marice, 26 years old and studying at a local University in Kupang; Rana, 22 years old, graduated from Senior High School. 

Yustriyani runs a kiosk business at her residence; she initiated the business 7 months ago. In order to generate more income Yustriyani also sells snacks, cakes, candies, and soft drinks at a school canteen near her house. She usually operates her kiosk business after school hours. 

Yustriyani intends to enlarge her two businesses by adding more items such as snacks, soft drinks and cakes. Therefore she is requesting an Individual loan from TLM of IDR 4,000,000. Yustriyani is hoping that she can get the loan assistance immediately.

loans.use: To purchase more items such as snacks, soft drinks and cakes.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, a 35-year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells clothing materials to people in the local community.

Ngoc requests a loan to purchase more products, such as clothes, needles, and thread, to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such as clothes, needles, and thread, to stock her store.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Luong is 62 years old with three grown children. She runs a small restaurant that serves fast food, beef noodles, and some ready food. Her business started years ago and creates stable income for her to manage her life. Joining our credit program in 2010, she used loans to invest in expanding her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy materials and some equipment.

loans.use: to buy materials and some equipment.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

Hugo sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo.
 
Hugo sigue siendo director de teatro y Mino de la escuela de teatro. La escuela de teatro tiene una línea pedagógica donde enseñan a confeccionar disfraces, mascaras y nariz de papayo.  En esta oportunidad Hugo requiere el préstamo para comprar más material para la elaboración de sus disfraces y mascaras. 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Hugo continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa''s 'Inti' community bank which is located in Cusco department, Peru.  The bank is in its third year and all the members are doing very well ('Inti' is a Quechuan word which means 'Sun').

Hugo continues living in the historic city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Most people in the city of Cusco work in tourism-related businesses and services.

Hugo continues working as a theater director and theater school coordinator.  The theater school has an educational course where they teach students how to make costumes, masks and fake noses.  On this occasion, Hugo needs a loan to buy more materials for making his costumes and masks.

Hugo is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given and pledges to make his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for making costumes and masks

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen, 40, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a labourer in a brick kiln. 

Quyen began to support her family through pig rearing one year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets, pig feed and repair her breeding facilities. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions, set aside some savings to meet any future difficulties, and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig feed and repair breeding facilities

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, a 43-year-old divorced woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. She runs a business that sells clothes-making materials to people in the local community.

Hai requests a loan to purchase more products, such as cloth, needles, and thread, to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such as cloth, needles, and thread, to stock her store.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is 32 years old and married.  She has 2 children. She and her husband support her family by selling rice in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her income and be able to improve her family's living conditions and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 55 years old and married.  She has 5 children, three sons and two daughters. Phuong and her husband support their family by breeding pigs. She would like to borrow a loan to buy piglets and pig feed, and to repair their breeding facilities. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions and can set aside some savings to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig feed, and to repair her breeding facilities

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch is about 50 and has 5 children.  They live in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She works as a local farmer along with her husband. With this type of business, Touch and her husband are able to generate enough for their livelihood. Nowadays, due to the lack of any vehicle in the family, Mrs. Touch’s family spends more each day on transportation fees. Therefore, Touch is looking for a loan in the amount of KHR1,500,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for the use of the whole family, as needed. Touch said this vehicle will provide her family a comfortable transportation to everywhere they wish, even though it is at a far distance. Her future goal is to enlarge her farmland and increase her rice production.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

Rocio sigue con el pequeño negocio de venta de joyas de material de oro y plata, ella elabora las joyas en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Rocio requiere el préstamo para comprar de oro y plata.

Rocio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rocío continues to belong to Inti Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the department of Cusco, Peru.  The communal bank is in its third year of operations and it is going well for all the members.  ("Inti" is a word from the Quechua language that translates into Spanish as "Sol" 'sun.')

Rocío continues with her small business selling gold and silver jewelry.  She makes the pieces in her small workshop that she set up in her home.  Currently she needs the loan to buy gold and silver.

Rocío is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she also promises to make the payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver to make jewelry

loans.name: Fatou Binetou

texts.fr:
Fatou est une jeune femme célibataire qui vit avec sa mère et ses 4 petits frères et sœurs. Depuis le décès de leur papa il y'a trois ans, elle est le principal soutien de la famille. En effet, elle pratique un commerce  d'huile de palm et de patte d'arachide qui lui permet de générer des revenus assez consistants. Elle achète ces produits en gros,dans un grand marché sous -régional à l'est du pays et les revend au détail à ses clients.Elle prend ainsi en charge les dépenses d'alimentation, de santé, de frais scolaires et d'électricité de la famille.
Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 8 seaux d'huile de palm, 9 bidons de 20 litres de patte d'arachide et d'autres produits divers. Son ambition est de renforcer d'avantage son commerce.
texts.en:
Fatou is a young, single woman who lives with her mother and her 4 little brothers and sisters. Since the death of their father 3 years ago, Fatou is the family´s main breadwinner. She sells palm oil and groundnut butter, which allows her to earn fairly consistent revenues. She buys her supplies wholesale, from a large sub-regional market in the East of the country, and resells them to her retail customers. This allows her to take care of the family´s food, medical and educational expenses, and pay for their electricity.

In order to increase her business, Fatou is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs with which to buy 8 buckets of palm oil, 9 20-litre cans of groundnut butter and various other products. She aims to further strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy 8 buckets of palm oil, 9 20-litre cans of groundnut butter and various other products.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich is a 45-year-old married woman.  She lives with her four daughters and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.  She and her husband have run a business selling fish for 10 years.

Bich is requesting a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy more fish to sell.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers as well as to attract new customers.  She also hopes that, through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family faces.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим- клиент в организации с 2011 го с апреля месяца. Сам по профессии он врач-фельдшер,в районной больнице. В выходные дни он занимается уходом за своими коровами, а в рабочие дни его жена.Она выводит их днём пастись на пастбища, а вечером пригоняет их сын.Иброхим на предыдущий кредит купил корм для коров и одного молодого бычка.Откормив его он продал за хорошую цену и на полученный доход отремонтировал крышу.Поэтому он планирует на полученный  кредит купить несколько мешков комбикорма для коров.
texts.en: Ibrohim has been a client of our organization since April of 2011.  He is a nurse practitioner at the district hospital.  He takes care of his cattle on the weekends, and his wife does so during work days.  She takes them out to a pasture at daytime, and their son brings them back in the evenings.  Ibrohim used his previous loan to buy cattle feed and one young bull.  He sold it at a good price after fattening it up and used the profit to repair his roof.  This is why he plans to use this loan to buy several bags of combi feed for cattle.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy is 20 years old with two small children.  Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens for eggs. Her business started two years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2010, she used her loans to expand her farming and poultry raising. For her new loan, she requires a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

Linh is 34 years old. She is managing a photography shop. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to improve her shop.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a factory worker. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business.  Girlie operates a variety store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Girlie hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Soi

texts.en:
Soi is a 49-year-old woman. She has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. Soi has been running a business selling clothing and bed linen for 11 years. 

Soi would like to take loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing, mosquito nets, blankets, mats, and pillows to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes, mosquito nets, blankets, mats, and pillows

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu, a widow, was born in 1955 and has 1 son.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising  pigs. When having free time, she goes to some neighboring areas to buy scrap products. 

Joining in our credit program in 2005, she used loans to expand her pig raising. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,938,000 VND  to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivation

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Имеет средне специальное образование, по специальности шафер. Он уже два года как занимается развозкой пассажиров по маршруту Душанбе - Вахдат. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Akmal lives in the Dangara region. He is 25 years old and married. He has secondary education and is a trained driver. For the past two years Akmal has been transporting passengers along the Dushanbe - Vahdat route. He is taking this loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: 01.02.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles with barbecue. Khuyên is 32 years old and married with one child. She is the group leader of the 01.2.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. Khuyên is requesting a loan to to purchase pork and noodles to make barbecue to sell.

Khuyên lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province, Viet Nam.  Khuyên has been involved in her business for one year. The main harship that Khuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2005, Khuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khuyên has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Khuyên hopes to make enough money to provide for her child, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase pork and noodles to make barbecue.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy, 26, is the loving mother of a young child, residing in Ang Snoul district. She works as sewing staff for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. She usually gets her payment monthly. She is able to earn more than $100 per month through her efforts. However, most days of the week, she has to work overtime.

With the sum of $1,100 which she requested, Thy will purchase marble flooring to cover her house. Mrs. Thy would like to live in a comfortable house with her family. In the future, she wants to open a general store from her house to serve people around the community. Moreover, she will ensure a bright future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase marble flooring for her house.

loans.name: Quen

texts.en:
Quen, 54, is widowed. She lives with with  two sons and two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Quen started supporting her family by raising pigs, poultry and fish two years ago. 

Quen is requesting a loan to buy piglets, chickens, and fish. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions, set aside some savings to meet future difficulties, and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy piglets, chickens, and fish.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom, 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over ten years and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, her husband runs the business of buying cattle to use in farming work as well as to resell for a profitable price to generate more income to support the family. Two of her children are employed as motorbike mechanics. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Yom is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more cattle to resell to make more profit for supporting the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to use in her farming work as well as to resell

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Lua is 48 years old.  She is married and has four children.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband works as a trader. 

Lua has supported her family by manufacturing bedding at her house for 10 years.  She manufactures items such as mattresses, blankets and pillows.  She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by buying equipment and materials to improve and increase her production of bedding and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes this loan enables her business to run smoothly and allows her to increase her income so that he can improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials to produce bedding including mattresses, blankets and pillows.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai was born in 1955 and has 2 grown sons. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising  oxen. When having free time, she goes to some neighboring areas to buying scrap products. Joining in our credit program in 2004, she used loans to expand her oxen raising. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,938,000 VND  to buy food for her ox and fertilizer for cultivation

loans.use: to buy food for her ox and fertilizer for cultivation

loans.name: 03.09.124 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phẩm works in agriculture, raising cattle . She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Phẩm is 56 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Phẩm is the group leader of the 03.09.124 Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Phẩm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phẩm has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phẩm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phẩm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Phẩm hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise

loans.name: 06.09.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles with meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase beef to make rice noodles with beef to sell.

Hoa is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 06.09.05-Đông Vệ solidarity group.  Hoa lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle meat to make rice noodles with beef.

loans.name: 01.01.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Xuân is applying for a loan to purchase shoes to resell. She has a retail business selling shoes. She is 60 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Xuân is the group leader of the 01.01.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2004, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids. She hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Seang Hai

texts.en:
Seang Hai, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They earn approximately USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed. They are a garment worker and a truck driver. 

Since the factory is far away from home, Seang Hai is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a motorbike for her child to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like purchase sows to breed to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house and send her younger children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her child to use to commute to work

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
Mr. Kon and his wife, shown in the photo, have been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Both members of this couple are in the same business, as local rice farmers. Besides farming, Kon devotes his time to selling shaken coconut juice from his home for more profit and raises some poultry as well. Kon has been blessed with three school-aged children who are dependent on him.

Kon is asking for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a used motorcycle. With the remainder of the money, he will buy some ingredients for his selling business. He hopes to improve business and earn a comfortable a living someday.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Kallpa Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Kallpa” es un banco comunal nuevo que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por  5 mujeres y 3 varones. Sus reuniones del banco comunal van a ser cada treinta días y todas las socias tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de velas flores, venta de hierbas, venta de ropa, venta de artefactos. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de transportes. 

En la fotografía la socia Gilda está levantando la mano).

La socia Gilda tiene 42 años y vive junto con su pareja y su único hijo, ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco (Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.). 

La socia Gilda es profesional y trabaja en una empresa privada en la ciudad del Cusco pero también tiene otra actividad que es brindar servicio de alquiler de carros, ella  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros. Su sueño de Gilda es comprar una casa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio de alquilar y le va muy bien. 

(La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso en día de la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Kallpa” Communal Bank is a new bank belonging to the Asociación Arariwa. It has 8 members; 5 women and 3 men. They will be meeting every thirty days, and every member must be present at the scheduled meetings. The majority of the members are neighbours and good friends.
The members are enterprising, hard workers who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and offer their children better futures through their hard work. Some examples of the group members' businesses include: selling candles with flowers on them; selling herbs; selling clothing; and selling appliances. Other members provide transportation services.
(In the photo, Gilda is the one raising her hand)
Gilda is 42 and lives with her partner and their only child in the city of Cusco. Cusco is known for being a tourist attraction, for trade, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.
Gilda is a professional and works for a private company in Cusco. She also rents cars. Gilda now needs a loan for vehicle maintenance. Her dream is to buy a home. She has rented cars for several years now and it is going very well for her.
(The member whose photo is inserted requested permission to be absent on the day of the meeting).

loans.use: with vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, 34, is married and resides with his wife and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for over three years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. His wife is a garment worker who can earn approximately USD 3 per day. Due to earning less income, Phat is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to use as a motor taxi, when he is free from his construction work, to generate more income to support the family.

 In the future, Phat plans to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger to provide comfortable living conditions for the family and support his child to study until he/she gets a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use as a motor taxi

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn, 49, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They earn approximately USD 3 per day. Additionally, her husband runs another business of breaking rock from the mountain to sell to generate extra income for the family. He can earn approximately USD 3 per day. Savoeurn's son is an excavator driver who earns approximately USD 5 per day.

 Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Savoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to buy modern tools for her husband to break the rock from the mountain to sell and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 52 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, por cosas de la vida lamentablemente quedo viuda y tuvo que hacerle frente a las cosas y criar sola a sus hijos. Pero felizmente tres de sus 6 hijos ya son mayores, pero aun con los otros tres tuvo que luchar mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. De ellos solo queda Cristian quien es el menor que vive con ella. El trabajo de Ana, consiste en hacer tortas y kekes, a diario ella hace para que pueda vender en su casa y para cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene. Su taller esta en su casa y es muy modesto, a pesar de esto es muy buena en su trabajo ya que tiene muchos pedidos y siempre tiene clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 30 años y lo hace con la ayuda de sus dos hijas quienes la apoyan en la producción diaria. Le esta yendo muy bien debido a que tiene muchos pedidos. Sabe que para poder tener a todos sus clientes contentos tiene que cumplir con todos y brindarles un producto de calidad. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero lo que mas desea es poder tener un taller más grande e implementado en donde pueda hacer mayor cantidad de productos. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual. Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para poder continuar su trabajo, además algunos materiales que necesita cambiar ya que se están empezando a deteriorar con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Ana, age 52, is a good woman who is friendly and hardworking. Unfortunately, life’s circumstances left her widowed so she has had to confront this challenge and raise her children alone. Happily, three of her six children are already grown while she strives to support the other three and provide them a better quality of life. Of these three children, Cristian is the youngest who lives with her. Ana’s work consists of making cakes and cupcakes on a daily basis, selling them from her home, and completing orders she receives. Her shop is in her house and is very modest. Despite this obstacle, she performs very good work and always has orders and customers.

Ana has been in this line of work for 30 years and has the help of her two daughters who assist with daily production. She has done very well as a result of her many orders. In order to keep all of her customers happy, she must finish all of their orders and provide a high-quality product. She has many plans for the future, but her greatest wish is to have a larger shop and to keep making high-quality products.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Ana is very pleased to be given financial backing so that she can increase her operating capital. She knows that she must be responsible and always punctual. The amount of 600 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients and supplies so that she can continue her work. In addition, some of her materials need to be replaced since they have started to deteriorate over time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, supplies, and utensils.

loans.name: Gloria Amelia

texts.es:
Gloria sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

Gloria sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo. 

Gloria continúa vendiendo café, cacao y miel, ella trae sus productos de la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco. Gloria con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Gloria requiere el préstamo para comprar miel.

La socia Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria still belongs to the "Inti" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, located in Cusco, Perú.This communal bank is three years old, and things are going well for all of the members. ("Inti" is a Quechua word meaning "sun").
Gloria still lives in the historical city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, Peru. The majority of people in Cusco run different businesses, mostly related to tourism.
Gloria is still selling coffee, cocoa and honey. She transports her products from the city of Quillabamba, Cusco department. With her previous loan, Gloria was very successful and her income increased. Gloria needs this loan to buy honey.
Gloria is grateful for this opportunity and promises to repay her quotas as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase honey to sell

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Wendy has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Wendy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Wendy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Grace Joy

texts.en:
Grace Joy is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace Joy has a shop that sells food seasonings, spices & vegetables. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy food seasonings, spices & vegetables to sell.

Grace Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Grace Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, spices & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Mrs. Pring, 31, cultivates rice for a livelihood, living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She has three children attending school and living under her care. Her husband shares the responsibility by working as a local plantation laborer around the province. 

Pring is taking out this loan to supplement her existing capital to build a suitable house to live in. This loan provides a good advantage for her family and therefore she is very appreciative of our lenders.

loans.use: to supplement her existing capital to build a suitable house to live in

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Helen has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar and stationery.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба женщина, которая занимается шитьём плащей. Она шьёт на заказ, знакомых. У неё двое взрослых сыновей, которые работают штукатурами, муж инвалид, сидит дома. У Матлюбы сгорел телевизор, поэтому она решила получить кредит и купить цветной телевизор. Из-за не сезонности работы сыновей, её семья не в силах купить телевизор в магазине за наличные деньги, из-за чего она и решила попросить кредит. На снимке Матлюба в день выдачи.
texts.en: Matluba is a woman, who is involved in sewing dresses.  She sews to-order for her friends.  Matluba has two adult sons, who work as plasterers, and her husband is disabled and stays home.  Matluba's television burned, and this is why she wants to obtain this loan and buy a color television.  Due to the seasonal nature of her sons' work, her family cannot purchase a television at a store with cash, hence is the reason for her to request a loan.  The photograph shows Matluba on the disbursement day.

loans.use: to purchase a television set

loans.name: Loc

texts.en: Loc is 26 years old with one  small child. She is running a small grocery shop that opened one year ago.  Her business creates a stable income for her family.  Participating in our credit program since 2010, she  has used loans effectively in expanding  her shop and is in a good repayment situation.  She wants to have a loan of 8,288,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 40 años de edad, es soltero con un hijo. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Antonio es un hombre dedicado a la carpintería, desde muy pequeño cuenta que incursionó en este negocio por que le gustaba los mubles, el detalle que lleva cada uno. Su primer trabajo lo hizo a los 12 años una silla entornada de cedro con tallado en el espaldar. Fue así que tiempos después lo contrataron para que trabaje como ebanista en el que se desempeño de manera sorprendente ya los clientes le conocían por los buenos muebles que realizaba. Pero con los trabajos que realizaba poco a poco fue comprando sus herramientas ahora cuenta con lo necesario para trabajar pero le falta muchas herramientas aun por comprar por falta de capital. Es por esta razón que Antonio decide recurrir a  MFP, por un crédito donde fue atendido de manera cordial y rápida.  Mas adelante Antonio esta pensando equiparse bien con buenas herramientas para así satisfacer las necesidades del cliente. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que Antonio se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprara mas madera para realizar sus muebles.
texts.en:
Antonio is 40 years old, single, and has one child. They live together in a rented house in the District of Pichari. Antonio engages in carpentry. At a young age, he started this business because he enjoys furniture and all of the details required in making each piece. He completed his first job 12 years ago and it involved making a cedar chair with carvings on the back. On numerous occasions, Antonio has been hired as a woodworker. He has produced amazing work and his customers know that he puts out fine furniture. As a result of the jobs he must complete, he is able to buy his equipment a little bit at a time. He is now in need of this equipment that he lacks for his work, but he does not have the capital. For this reason, Antonio decided to return to MFP for a loan because he also receives fast and friendly service.

Going forward, Antonio believes he will be well-equipped with good tools so that he can satisfy the needs of his customers. This will be his second loan with MFP. For this reason, Antonio promises once again to submit his loan payments on time. The amount of 1000 PEN will be used to buy more wood for making furniture.

loans.use: to buy more wood.

loans.name: Rodny Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 
Hugo sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo. 
Hugo continúa vendiendo productos energéticos y alimenticios de la marca TIENS. Hugo con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad Hugo requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos energéticos.
texts.en:
Hugo still belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa's "Inti" Communal Bank, located in the Cusco department, Peru. The communal bank is three years old and things are going well for all of the members. ("Inti" is the Quechua word for "sun").
Hugh still lives in the historical city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, Peru. The majority of the people in Cusco have businesses related to tourism.
Hugo is still selling TIENS brand food and energy food items. Hugo was very successful with his previous loan and he was able to increase his income. Hugo needs this loan to buy more energy products.

loans.use: to purchase energy & food products to sell

loans.name: Denden

texts.en:
This is Denden, a 24-year-old mother of two, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines, and wife to Benjamin, a barber. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Denden operates a barbershop offering hair styling, hair grooming and the like, with her husband as the main barber. Their regular customers are their neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from services everyday.

To help her continue business operations, Denden is requesting a loan of Php 27,000 to buy supplies for her barbershop including shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, etc. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.

Denden dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora Claudina es una señora de 62 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, provincia cercado en el departamento de Cochabamba. Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de verduras que lo realiza en la misma puerta de su casa, vende en poca cantidad variedad de verduras a toda la vecindad de su zona. Ahora ella solicita un prestamo de KIVA mediante la institucion financiera CIDRE para hacer perforar un pozo para su vivienda, ya que actualmente ellos reciben agua de sisterna por que donde su barrio existe escasez de agua. este pozo le servira para su uso diario, para instalar una ducha, y para lavar mejor las verduras que ella vende y asi poder ofrecer un producto mas limpio.
texts.en:
Claudina is a 62 year-old woman who lives in the city of Cochabamba, a province within the district of Cochabamba.  She has a small business selling vegetables, which she carries out from the doorway of her home.  She sells a variety of vegetables in small quantities to the residents of the area.

She is requesting a Kiva loan now by means of the CIDRE financing institution to dig a well for her house.  They currently get their water from a cistern, as there is a scarcity of water in the area where her neighborhood is located.  This well will serve her for daily use, to install a shower, and to better wash her vegetables so she can offer a cleaner product.

loans.use: dig a well for her house.

loans.name: Ndeye Marie

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  Marie vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis 26 ans. Elle s’adonne a al vente de tissus teintés. Elle a choisi son activité dans le but de gagner des bénéfices qui lui permettent de subvenir a ses propres besoins. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus ce sont les flux financiers. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEc depuis décembre 2010.Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour le démarrage de la vente de vaisselle, d’orange et divers autres produits saisonniers. Ce financement lui permettra de diversifier son activité, d’accroitre ses revenus et de mieux prendre en charge ses frais de location.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndeye Marie lives in Senegal. She has been working in commerce for 26 years. She [mostly] specializes in selling dyed cloth. She has chosen this type of work with the goal of earning an income that would allow her to provide for her needs. The financial aspect is what interests her most. She has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since December 2010. She has already reimbursed a previous loan. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 West African Francs in order to buy plates, oranges and other seasonal products. This financing will allow her to diversify her business, increase her revenues, and better  manage the cost of her lease.

loans.use: to buy plates and various articles for resale

loans.name: Luis Edgardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42  años de edad, es padre de familia de  dos hijos, actualmente vive junto a ellos y su esposa en su casa ubicada en un distrito rural donde la actividad comercial principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, el caserío donde vive esta ubicado a unos escasos minutos del Distrito de Tambogrande, el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Piura. Por ser un caserío rural por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de Energía eléctrica.

Luís desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo, trabajo que lo realizaba junto a sus padres, su misma experiencia en el campo origino que con el transcurrir de los años él pueda tener sus propios terrenos agrícolas para lo que ha obtenido 1.70 has donde ha sembrado Limón Y Maracayá. Su esposa logró terminar una carrera técnica de educación, profesión que ahora desempeña en su mismo caserío ayudando a Luís con la canasta familiar, y es que existe una muy buena relación familiar por lo que trabajan juntos para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos.

Los plantaciones frutales de Luís están en una etapa en la cual necesitan de fertilizantes y otros abonos por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito en edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán invertidos para la compra de los mismos, esto ayudara a mejorar la producción y puedan ser vendidos en mejores y precios y mercados a la vez.

Los proyectos que Luís y su esposa se han trazado viene siendo cumplido de manera oportuna y eficiente, es que la responsabilidad de ambos es el valor que mas los caracteriza.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old and the father of two children.  He currently lives together with them and his wife in a house located in a rural district, where the primary commercial activity is farming and raising livestock.  The village where he lives is located just a few minutes from the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the province of Piura.  Because it is a rural area, they currently only have the public service of electricity.

From a young age, Luis has dedicated himself to working the land, a task he used to carry out at his parents’ side.  This same farming experience led to, after the passing of years, him being able to have his own farmland; he has obtained 1.70 hectares where he has planted lemons and passion fruit.  His wife managed to finish a degree in education, a profession that she now fulfills in the town where they live, helping Luis with the family’s needs.  They have a very good relationship, and work together to meet their goals.

The fact that Luis’ fruit plants are in a phase where they need fertilizers is the reason he has decided to request a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.  He will invest these funds into the purchase of these, which will help him improve production and sell his crops at better prices.

The projects that Luis and his wife have laid out are being carried out in an opportune and efficient way.  The trait that characterizes them both best is their responsible nature.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik is 50 years old and lives in the village of Zovaber in Sevan with his wife and only son. Gagik’s wife stays at home and does housework, and his son attends a school. Gagik is a tractor driver and for many years has worked as a driver for different organizations. Since 1992, Gagik has been engaged in an agricultural business; on his farm Gagik breeds two cows, two goats, sheep and chickens. He also grows potatoes, carrots, cabbages, etc. Gagik’s wife helps him a lot and they sell the agricultural products at the market. Thanks to farming, Gagik and his wife are able to provide for their family. Gagik needs a 400.000 AMD loan to buy potato seed grains and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy potato seed grains and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Anna, a 33-year-old business lady, is married to John, a businessman, and they are blessed with one child. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

Now applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer, Anna will use the money to buy a stock of clothes. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to rent a house and sell clothing from one location.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan is a 53-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children. He is a cattle breeder and has five years of experience in this field. Elkhan chose this particular activity because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and most of the national dishes like dolma and pilau are made of meat. Also Elkhan keeps cows for milk and yoghurt sales.

Elkhan usually buys small calves in the central bazaar, fattens and raises them for 5-6 months. Then, he resells the grown cattle at a more profitable price to market vendors and butchers. His wife helps to look after the animals and feed them.  

Demand for fresh meat and milk products is very high, and Elkhan would like to meet the demand of his permanent clients. For this purpose, he applied for a 1350 Azerbaijani manat loan. He will use the loan to buy one cow and two calves.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and two calves

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es: El señor Florencio se dedica a la venta de artículos varios y por temporada, como por ejemplo: baterías para radios, controles de televisor etc. cremas de lustrar calzado, pasta dental, cargadores para celular y todo tipo de artículos según la época del año.  el negocio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de la 12 de octubre de la cuidad de El Alto de La Paz - Bolivia, esta zona es la mas populosa y céntrica de la ciudad de El Alto, el mayor sueño del señor Florencio es que algún día sus dos pequeño hijos puedan estudiar en la universidad y así poder forjarse  un futuro mejor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material escolar por mayor para poder vender ya que esta época empiezan las labores escolares y hay mucha de manda de estos productos y el desea aprovechar esta época con la venta de estos productos, el Sr. Florencio es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos ya que ellos son el impulso que necesita para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Florencio dedicates himself to selling a variety of seasonal articles such as, for example:  radio batteries, TV remote controls, etc., shoe polish, toothpaste, cell phone chargers, and all types of items depending on the time of year.  The business is located in the 12th of October zone of the city of El Alto, in La Paz, Bolivia.  This is the most populous and central section of the city of El Alto.

Florencio’s greatest wish is for his young children to one day have the opportunity to go to college, so they can build a brighter future for themselves.  On this occasion, he requests a loan to buy school supplies at wholesale to sell.  He wants to take advantage of the fact that the school season is approaching, and there is a big demand for these types of products.

Florencio is a very hard working person who is always thinking about his children’s well being, as they are the impetus he needs to continue forging ahead.

loans.use: buy school supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora Evelyn, se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos y regalos, los cuales los vende los fines de semana en la puerta de los salones de fiestas.
El crédito lo requiere para incrementar su capital desea comprar mas artículos y ponerlos a la venta para obtener mas ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Evelyn, es casada y tiene un hijo, viven en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Sra. Evelyn buys and sells merchandise and gifts that she offers on the weekends from the doorsteps of banquet halls. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy more merchandise and sell these goods at a profit in order to generate more income to support her family. Evelyn is married and has one child. They live at the home of her in-laws in the District of El Tejar of the city of La Paz.

This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy merchandise used as party gifts.

loans.name: Andres Fredy

texts.es: El cliente Andrés Fredy,  es un señor de 30 años de edad, es soltero, trabaja en el sector de la educación, presta sus servicios como profesor de una unidad educativa en una provincia que se encuentra a 5 horas de viaje de la ciudad de Cochabamba, que está ubicado  al cono sur de la ciudad,  actualmente el cliente vive por la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia y de su hermano, el cliente vive con su hermano. El destino del nuevo crédito es para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en malas condiciones, el  cliente quiere mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que las lluvias de esta época está dañando casi toda la plataforma de la casita, cuya construcción es de adobe, y es una casita muy antigua, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: The client is Andrés Fredy. He is a 30 year old single man. He works in education. Andrés Fredy is a teacher at a school in a province five hours from the city of Cochabamba. It’s located in the southern cone of the city. Currently, the client lives in the southern zone of the city of Cochabamba. The house he lives in belongs to himself and his brother. He lives with his brother. The new loan is for improving their home because it is in bad shape. The client wants to improve the roof of his home because the rains at this time are damaging most of the small house’s platform. The house is constructed of adobe and the small house is very old. Therefore, we’re sharing this small story about the client for everyone’s knowledge.

loans.use: with his home's construction.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz is a 39-year-old man and an internally displaced person (IDP*) who lives in IDP Settlement with his wife and five children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 8 years. During these years Avaz gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes like pilau and dolma are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan families and they also make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 260 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Avaz wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.


*An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propia tienda de barrio ubicada en la urbanización unificada al norte de la ciudad de El Alto de la Paz Bolivia, esta actividad la realiza hace mas de 15 años, la señora Elena abre su tienda a las 6:00 am y termina su labor a las 23:00 pm, las ventas son diarias ya que los artículos que oferta son de primera necesidad, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de abarrotes como fideo, arroz, azúcar y aceite, la señora Elena no tiene esposo por lo que lucha cada día para salir adelante y algún día sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional y así puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena dedicates herself to selling groceries in her own neighborhood store, located to the north of the city of El Alto in La Paz, Bolivia.  She has been carrying out this activity for more than 15 years. 

Elena opens her store at 6:00 am and finishes working at 11:00 pm.  She sells on a daily basis as the products she offers are of primary necessity.  She will use the funds from her loan to buy groceries such as noodles, rice, sugar and oil.
 
Elena does not have a husband, a reason why she struggles every day to get ahead.  She hopes her children will one day be able to study to become professionals and, in this way, improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy groceries such as noodles, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Elshen

texts.en:
Elshen is 23 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents.  He sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop.  Elshen has 5 years of experience in this field, which makes him as knowledgeable and skilled person in his business.

The food products he sells is very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 130 AZN. His father helps him to sell products in shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location of his shop in the central bazaar of his home city.

But the profit he earns is not enough to reinvest into the business and covering his customers' demand is suffering for this reason. Being the only source of income, his profit is used for family needs.  Elshen would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 1000 AZN to purchase and diversify his inventory of foodstuff.

loans.use: to buy more food product

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 35,000 KES to buy tomatoes, bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bananas and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 37 years old and married with one child. He has rental houses. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber and iron sheets for building other rental houses.

loans.use: to buy timber and iron sheets for building other rental houses.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif is 51 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He is a market vendor and sells different types of food items.  The most popular items he sells include candies, sausages, macaroni, tinned food and juices. Akif has seven years of experience selling food items and, during this time, he has acquired the necessary skills required to be successful.  His monthly income is 200 AZN.  His elder son helps him to sell in the shop.

Akif would like to diversify his product offering and purchase more merchandise.  This will help him increase sales and improve his family’s living conditions.  In order to do this, he needs additional capital and he has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This will be Akifs fourth loan and he has perfect credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Clara Jesus

texts.es:
Clara de 43 años de edad es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora,  tiene  4hijos de los cuales solo uno es dependiente de ella, los demás son trabajadores independientes, vive junto a su esposo en un caserío rural anexo a Olmos de nombre “Filoque Grande” el cual esta a unos escasos minutos del distrito de Olmos a unas 2 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Debido a que Clara es una mujer trabajadora y muy luchadora por sus objetivos, con el tiempo ah logrado ahorrar su dinero el cual ha sido obtenido de su trabajo en el campo al que se ha dedicado anteriormente, con el dinero que logró ahorrar se compro dos moto taxis las cuales ahora las da al alquiler para el transporte de pasajeros de caserío en caserío, generándose un ingreso diario y es que esta proyectada con el tiempo comprarse dos mas para lo que ya viene trabajando.

Su esposo al igual que ella también esta comprometido con los objetivos de superación por lo que se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente como maestro constructor en toda la zona donde viven con lo que también genera ingresos semanales para su casa.

En los últimos días a Clara se le han presentado algunos inconvenientes  no solo con la infraestructura de su casa si no que también uno de los motores de su vehiculo esta fallando por lo que ha creído necesario solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles con lo que comprara materiales de construcción y un motor nuevo para su mejor funcionamiento de su vehiculo y así pueda trabajar de manera normal.
texts.en:
Clara is 43 years old and a mother who is very responsible and hard working.  She has 4 children, of whom only one is dependent on her; the rest work on their own.  She lives with her husband in a rural area of Olmos named “Filoque Grande”, which is only a few minutes from the district of Olmos and approximately 2 hours from the city of Lambayeque.

Because Clara is a hard-working woman who fights to meet her goals, over time, she has managed to save money she obtained from her previous work in farming.  She bought two moto taxis with the money she saved, and now rents them out to transport passengers from town to town.  This work generates her income on a daily basis and she projects that, over time, she will purchase two more vehicles, which is something she is already working towards.

Her husband, like her, is committed to the goal of succeeding, which is why he works independently as a master builder throughout the zone where they live.  With this work, he also earns weekly income for the household.

In the past few days, Clara has met with some inconveniences not only related to the infrastructure of her house, but also the failure of one of her vehicle’s engines.  For these reasons, she has felt it necessary to turn to Edpyme Alternative to request a loan in the amount of 3,000 Peruvian soles.  She will use the funds to buy construction materials and also a new engine for her vehicle, so she can continue her work in a normal manner.

loans.use: buy motorcycle replacement parts and construction materials.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old, married and has 7 children, 2 of whom are in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick is a 36-year-old food stall owner in Mariakani. He is a married father of three. His business has been in operation for the past year and it’s doing great.

This marks his third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes. He hopes to earn profits from his expanded business which he will use to educate his children. 

His dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Flordeliza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zhumanazar

texts.ru: Жуманазар более 16 лет в бизнесе. Он запрашивает займ уже на 35 цикле,у него безупречное кредитное досье. Он начал свой бизнес с продажи  различных мелочей необходимых для домохозяйства. Его жена также участвует в бизнесе, чтобы помогать мужу. Жуманазар хотел бы получить займ для покупки товаров- различных мелочей для домохозяйства такие как розетки, шнуры, светильники, крема для обуви, зарядники, вилки, включатели и т.д. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zhumanazar has been engaged in business for over 16 years. This is the 35th time he is taking a loan, and he has an impeccable credit history. He began his business by selling various small household items. His wife is also involved in the business in order to help her husband. Zhumanazar would like to receive a loan to purchase merchandise - assorted household items such as power outlets, cables, light fixtures, shoe polish, chargers, plugs, electrical switches etc. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en:
Ma. Violeta works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Violeta requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Ma. Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.ru: Зарифджон более 8 лет занимается предоставлением транспортных услуг. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Имеет автомашины марки «Зил» и «Газель». Он предоставляет услуги по перевозке грузов. На своем грузовом автомашине он привозит яблоки, греческие орехи и сухофрукты, а затем продает в других кишлаках. В зависимости от грузов он пользуется автомашинами. Он получает хорошую прибыль от данного бизнеса. Зарифджон запрашивает займ в размере 8000 Сомони для ремонта своих автомобилей.
texts.en: Zarifjon has been providing transportation services for over 8 years. He is married and is raising three children. His wife takes care of the household. Zarifjon has "Zil" and "Gazel" vehicles. He delivers apples, walnuts and dry fruit, which he then sells in other villages. This business brings him a good income. Zarifjon is asking for a loan of 8000 somoni to repair his vehicles.

loans.use: to repair his vehicles

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Шамсиддин житель города Вахдат. Женат. Ему 34 года. У него трое детей. Он таксист, он занимается развозкой людей с одного места на другое. Этим видом деятельности занимается год. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Shamsiddin is a resident of the town of Vahdat. He is married and has three children. He is 34 years old. Shamsiddin is a taxi driver, he transports people from one location to another. He has been in this business for one year. He is taking out the loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair the car.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis es casado con la señora Martha más de 6 años, ambos con una edad de 32 años, saben leer y escribir, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales estudian 3, viven en la comunidad Candelaria pueblo de Mosoj Rancho hacia el norte de Colomi de la ciudad de Cochabamba más de 11 años.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 El señor José Luis y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, papaliza, cultivan en terreno de  herencia de sus padres comunidad Salto "B", don José Luis nos cuenta que hicieron construir una vivienda de dos plantas donde invirtieron todo el ahorro que tenían y les falto dinero para la obra fina, por este motivo ellos vinieron a solicitar un crédito a nuestra oficina de Cidre, para lo cual se llevaron una respuesta positiva ya que en otros Instituciones les pidieron muchos requisitos, se sintieron muy felices ahora más que nunca van poder vivir más cómodos y trabajando para que él y su familia tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Señor José Luis has been married to Martha for over six years. They are both 32 and can read and write. Jose Luis and Martha have four children, three of whom are in school. They live in the Candelaria community, in the Mosoj Rancho village toward the north of Colomi, Cochabamba. They have lived there for over 11 years.
Jose Luis and his wife work in agriculture. They sow potato, beans, and papalisa potatoes. They cultivate a plot of land they they inherited from their parents, in the Salto "B" community. Jose Luis tells us that he build a two-story home and invested all of their savings in it. They do not have enough money for the finish work. Because of this, they have decided to request a loan from our Cidre office. They have had a positive experience here, because other institutions had many requisites. They are very happy because now they will be able to live more comfortably and work for their family's future.

loans.use: with building his home: the finish work

loans.name: Marisol Iris

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 38 años de edad, es una persona con ganas de salir adelante. Ella vive en la zona central de la ciudad de Cochabamba, se dedica a la venta de comida junto con su familia,  es madre soltera, tiene una hija pequeña; hace algunos años atrás que se separó de su pareja, actualmente trabaja para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
Marisol, necesita el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas para su negocio y de esta manera pueda brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela y posteriormente tenga mayor afluencia de comensales. Ella está muy agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de seguir adelante con la actividad que realiza.
La señora Marisol piensa en  futuro volver a sacar un nuevo préstamo para terminar de construir su vivienda y para los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Marisol is 38, and a person eager to move forward in her life. She lives in the central area of the city of Cochabamba, and she and her family sell food.  She is a single mother and has a small daughter. A few years ago she separated from her partner. Now she is working to improve her family's standard of living. 

Marisol needs the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business, enabling her to provide better service to her customers, and attract more diners in the future. She is very grateful to the people who, through Kiva, have given her the opportunity to continue with her livelihood. 

In the future Marisol is thinking about taking out another loan, in order to finish building her house, and for her daughter's schooling.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Las Bolivianitas - 26 Group

texts.es: Es  banco de emprendimiento LAS BOLIVIANITAS – 26 es una banco antiguo muy responsable compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta es la Sra. Angélica se dedica a la venta de comida y desayunos por un acalle muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz, vende  todos los días  sale a vender a tempranas horas de la mañana, es muy conocida en el lugar vive,  como todas sus compañeras también son  vecinas se conocen muy bien decidieron conformar la banca comunal la presidenta tiene 3 hijos y todos van al colegio  es casada su esposo trabaja en una imprenta  de diseñador grafico, decidió sacar el préstamo para la compra de insumos como café en polvo y azúcar para la elaborar sus desayunos y así de esta manera incrementar su capital y así crecer en el negocio, la Sra. Angélica es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "Las Bolivianitas-26" communal bank is a long-established, responsible group made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The chairperson is Angélica, who sells meals, including breakfasts, on a very busy street in the city of La Paz.  

She sells every day, and goes out at in the early hours of the morning. She is well-known in the place where she lives. 

As all her friends are also neighbors, they know one another very well, and decided to create the communal bank. The chairperson has three children, and all of them go to school. She is married, and her husband is a graphic designer for a printing company.

She decided to take out the loan to buy supplies such as ground coffee and sugar for making her breakfasts. In this way she will increase her working capital and enable her business to grow. 

Angélica is a very hard-working person, and she feels happy and thankful to the institution for the support offered to her.

loans.use: To buy ground coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 2 hijos, ella tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en caserío rural en el que se dedican a la agricultora y ganadería exclusivamente, el caserío donde ellos viven lleva por nombre CP-3 del distrito de Tambogrande. A unos escasos minutos de la provincia de Piura. Por ser caseríos que están en vía se desarrollo es que por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica 

Rosa es una mujer que la gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado al campo ya sea por la agricultura o la ganadería, negocios los cuales han sido el sustento de sus padres y de ella misma cuando era joven, ahora ya con familia pone en practica lo que de pequeña aprendió, pues ella se dedica a la crianza, engorde y posterior venta de animales de corral, como pavos, patos, ovinos y entre otros mientras que su esposo a la agricultura. Ambos se han proyectado  a incrementar ambos ingresos debido a que desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ellos y para sus hijos darle una buena alimentación y educación correspondiente.

Rosa ha decidido solicitar un crédito de 1500 Nuevos Soles en Edpyme Alternativa, debido a que cuenta con plantación de Limón por lo que necesita comprar fertilizantes para mejorar su producción, y a la vez comprar alimentos balanceados para los animales que cría su esposa.

En le caserío donde viven se ganado el respeto ya consideración por ser personas de buen carácter y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, is the mother of 2 children and she lives with her husband in the rural village CP-3 in the Tambogrande district, very close to Piura province.    The village focuses exclusively on agriculture and animal raising.  It is a village with basic development that at present only has electrical service.

Rosa has spent much of her life working in the fields, both for farming and for animal raising, businesses that have been the financial support for her parents and for her when she was young.  Now with her family she puts what she learned as a child into practice.  She raises, fattens, and then sells animals such as turkeys, ducks, sheep  and others while her husband does the farming.  Both have projected an increase in their incomes so that they can improve the standard of living for themselves and their children.  They want to be able to give them good food and an education.

Rosa has requested a loan of 1500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa for her lemon grove.  She needs to buy fertilizer to improve her production and also to purchase balanced feed for the animals that she raises.

They have gained the respect from others in their village and are considered hardworking people of good character.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed for her animals and fertilizers for her lemon grove

loans.name: Mirian
